children.definition: embark together, τινι with one, Luc. Nav. 15; συνεμβήσητε (sic) ἅμα ἡμῖν εἰς ῥώμσιν Pap. in Glotta 2.150; συνεμβάς μοι εἰς πλοῖον BGU 1817.12 (i B.C.): metaph., σ. τινὶ εἰς τὴν θάλατταν embark with one upon naval power, Plb. 1.20.7; εἰς πόλεμον (sc. τινι) Id. 29.3.8; εἰς ἀπέχθειαν ἅμα τινί Id. 16.26.6; ἐν πλείοσιν τῶν τῇ πόλει συμφερόντων καὶ κοινῇ τοῖς πολίταις καὶ ἰδίᾳ ἑκάστῳ σ. Supp.Epigr. 7.62.9 (Seleucia Pieria, ii B.C.); ἐς τὰ παρακαλούμενα ὑφʼ ὑμίων συνεμβάντες GDI 5183.18 (Crete, found at Teos, ii B.C.); σ. εἰς ἡρωϊκὰ μεγέθη engage in them, of a poet, Longin. 9.10, cf. 13.4.

data.quote: ἐς τὰ παρακαλούμενα ὑφʼ ὑμίων συνεμβάντες

children.definition: help in applying, τοὺς μοχλούς Ar. Lys. 246.
put in together with, αὐτῷ λωτομήτρας σπέρμα PMag.Par. 1.754, cf. Dsc. 1.52, Plu. Isid. 2.380e, PHolm. 7.40:— Pass., Agatharch. 28, Herod.Med. ap. Orib. 6.20.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: fall upon also, join in attacking, X. HG 7.4.22; σ. εἰς τὴν Ἀττικήν make a joint inroad . . , D. 18.213, cf. 229.
put on board together, prob. in D.S. 20.68.
one must throw in together, Gal. 12.565, Orib. Fr. 58.
to be thrown in together, Herod.Med. ap. Aët. 9.37.

throwing in together, κώπης ῥοθιάδος ξ. the regular dip of all the oars together, to the sound of the κέλευσμα, A. Pers. 396:—in Id. Ag. 984 (lyr.), πρυμνησίων ξυνεμβολάς ( Headlam) may be read for ξυνεμβόλοις, in concrete sense the cables cast out from the stern.

definition: συνέμεν, Dor. aor. 2 inf. of συνίημι (q. v.).

children.definition: vomit up together, ἕλμινθας Hp. Prorrh. 2.28.
strew upon along with or together, Dsc. 5.75.
burn together, E. Rh. 489, Nic.Dam. Fr. 68 J.:— Pass., συνεμπεπρῆσθαι τῷ ναῷ Str. 14.1.22, cf. 15.1.68, Ar.Did. Epit. 12.
fall or be put in also, ἐς τὸ πῦρ Luc. Peregr. 24, cf. DMort. 20[10].4.
fall on or attack together, Plu. Brut. 42 (s. v.l.); of diseases, σ. τινί Hp. Acut. 42, Gal. 16.493, Aret. SA 2.6 codd. (leg. συμπ-).
befall also, εἴ τι τοιοῦτον συνεμπέσοι αὐτῷ might befall him too, Arist. Rh.Al. 1444a14.

to be thrown together, κατὰ τὠυτό Hp. Vict. 1.27 (v.l. συνεκ-), cf. Plu. Pyth. 2.399e; coincide in form, -ουσαι λέξεις A.D. Pron. 52.4, al.; τοῖς παλαιοῖς, i.e. by repeating their words, Artem. 2.1; of metrical phrases, Sch. Ar. Nu. 651; Astrol., come together, Vett.Val. 90.27, 333.23.
fall to be included in, σὺν τοῖς καὶ εἰς τούτους συνεμπεσουμένοις φορτίοις πᾶσι POxy. 243.33 (i A.D.), cf. 503.14 (ii A.D.).

data.quote: σὺν τοῖς καὶ εἰς τούτους συνεμπεσουμένοις φορτίοις πᾶσι

children.definition: implicate also, αἰτίαις σ. τινά J. BJ 7.11.2; τῷ ἐγκλήματί τινα Plu. Adul. 2.71f:— Pass., συνεμπέπλεκται τῷ ἀναγνωσθέντι ὑπομνήματι is also involved in . . , Mitteis Chr. 89.32 (ii A.D.) .
inspire along with, μετὰ τῶν λόγων μένος καὶ θυμόν Phld. Ind.Sto. 35.

data.quote: μετὰ τῶν λόγων μένος καὶ θυμόν

children.label: II
children.definition: blow favourably on, τοῖς ἀγῶσι Longin. 9.11.
fellow-traveller, companion, A. Ch. 208, 713, S. Tr. 318, Ph. 542: c.gen.pers., οἱ ξ. σέθεν A. Supp. 939; opp. ἡγεμών (a guide), Pl. Phd. 108b: c. dat., ξυνεμπόρους ἐμοί E. Ba. 57, cf. Hel. 1538.
λύπη δʼ ἄμισθός ἐστί σοι ξ. A. Ch. 733: c.gen.rei, χορείας partner in . . , Ar. Ra. 398 (lyr.); σ. ἀνέρι κέρδους partner with him for gain, AP 9.415 ( Antiphil.).
formal coincidence, [ μέτρων] Sch.Heph. p.154 C.; σ. Σοφοκλεῖ καὶ Εὐριπίδῃ a coincidence (of language) between . . , Sch. Ar. Th. 21; σ. ἱστορική Ptol.Heph. ap. Phot. Bibl. p.148 B.

children.label: II
children.definition: similarity of form, A.D. Pron. 52.5, al.; τόνου Id. Adv. 155.13.
burn, consume at the same time, Supp.Epigr. 6.184 ( Phrygia, iii A.D.).

indicate at the same time or incidentally, Thphr. HP 3.8.1, Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1012.37, Gal. 15.795, Ath. 14.663c, Iamb. Comm.Math. 8; σ. ὅτι . . D.S. 3.3:— Pass., appear together, Thphr. HP 1.12.2; to be indicated at the same time, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.51, Gal. 6.93, 7.319, Hermog. Id. 2.6.
joint or secondary indication, τινος of a thing, S.E. M. 7.239, Ath. 7.325b.
bring in with, M.Ant. 3.4:— Pass., to be imported with, Aët. 7.40.
to be plunged in, πόνοις -φῠρείς Vett.Val. 330.16.
grow together, unite, Gal. 2.376, 18(2).977.
indicate together, Gal. 10.626:— Med. and Pass., c. dat., Id. 6.647, 648, 15.464, al.

definition: συνενδεκατίζω, f.l. for ἐνδεκάζω in D. 58.40, according to Harp.; cf. συνδεκαδίζω.

children.definition: binding in together, τινὸς πρός τι Sch. Il. 4.133.
give way also, Str. 1.3.5, Plu. Caes. 31; give way, D.S. 17.43; ἐπιθυμίαις Plu. Per. 15.
giving in, giving way, Plu. QConv. 2.680a.
put on, θώρακα Arr. An. 1.25.2.
strike or dash against, τῷ δὴ συνενείκεται Hes. Sc. 440.
to be all in together, POxy. 929.12 (ii/iii A.D.).
to be active at the same time, Plot. 3.4.6, Ascl. in Metaph. 282.5.
active at the same time, Ascl. in Metaph. 286.22.
to be buried together, TAM 2.599.4 ( Tlos).
to be inspired and rave together, of the Bacchae, D.S. 4.3.
= foreg., Plb. 38.12.7; ταῖς ὑπερβολαῖς Str. 3.2.9, etc.; τινι with a person, Plu. Cor. 17; or at a thing, Longin. 13.2; to be inspired with admiration for, c.dat., Eun. Hist. p.215 D.
Pass., πρός τι Procl. in Prm. p.530S.
agree with, τινι, A.R. 4.1277 (tm.).
join in thought, Ph. 2.331:— Med., remind oneself also, Eust. 71.28.
one must supply in thought, Eust. 262.4, al.
trouble as well, Aët. 9.42.

unite, Ar.Byz. Epit. 38.12, Damocr. ap. Gal. 13.800, Zos. Alch. p.142 B., Phlp. in GA 20.33:— Pass., pf. συνένωμαι or -ήνωμαι, to be united, c. dat., J. BJ 5.4.3, S.E. M. 9.130, PStrassb. 31.11 (iii A.D.), etc.; Gramm., form a compound with, ὀνόματι A.D. Synt. 314.1.
a putting on the stretch, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.233, Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.589a. Placit. 4.15.3, Antyll. ap. Orib. 6.27.11, Gal. 6.171.
right of joint burial, TAM 2.601,604 ( Tlos).

put on the stretch together, τὸ πνεῦμα Sor. 1.70b; τοὺς κατʼ ἐπιγάστριον μῦς Gal. 6.173:— Med., exert oneself also, -ομένης ἅμα τῆς κυούσης Sor. 1.73:— Pass., to be on the stretch together, ψυχὴ σ. σώματι Muson. Fr. 11p.58H., cf. Stoic. 2.234, Gal. 6.177, v.l. for συνεκ- in Placit. 4.13.11.
Hsch.
Hsch.; cf. αὐθέντης.
lead out together, στρατιήν Hdt. 5.75; σ. τι εἰς φῶς assist in bringing it out, Pl. Tht. 157d.

children.label: II
children.definition: carry off together, assist in removing, οἱ ἔμετοι σ. τὸ γλίσχρον Arist. Pr. 868b7; ἥλιος σ. τὴν ὑγρότητα Thphr. CP 4.13.5; τοὺς συναγωνιστάς Plu. An seni 2.787e; σ. ἑαυτήν, of suicide, App. BC 4.23.
Pass., to be carried away at the same time, οἴκτῳ καὶ μανίῃ APl. 16.128.
change into air together, v.l. in Lyd. Mens. 4.40.
put into the open air together, Dsc. 3.146 ( Pass.).
make bloody together, Ph. 2.96.
take out together, help in removing, συνεξελεῖν ὑμῖν τὸ θηρίον ἐκ τῆς χώρης Hdt. 1.36; συμφόνευε καὶ συνεξαίρει δόμων E. Ion 1044:— Med., σ. τὸ προνοεῖσθαι take it away also, X. Cyn. 5.28.

data.quote: συνεξελεῖν ὑμῖν τὸ θηρίον ἐκ τῆς χώρης

children.definition: Act., help in taking, σ. τισὶ Σελλασίαν Id. HG 7.4.12, cf. Th. 2.29 (v.l. ξυνελεῖν) ; μετά τινος Ἀμφίπολιν Aeschin. 2.32, cf. IG 2(2).127.45; σ. δορί E. Ion 61; Φρύγας Id. Tr. 24; Τροίαν Isoc. 9.18.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., help in rescuing, Plb. 5.11.5.

assist in raising, τὴν θάλατταν Str. 3.5.7; raise together, εἰς ὄγκον τοὺς μῦς Gal. 6.296:— Pass., to be raised together, τῷ διαφράγματι ib. 173; to be swollen at the same time, Id. 18(2).268; συνεξαρθεὶς ὑπό τινων being lifted up by the joint effort of . . , Plu. Ant. 12.

σ. τὴν ἠχώ help in calling forth the echo, Philostr. Im. 1.18; σ. θρῆνον Hld. 7.15; σ. τὴν φιλοτιμίαν Plu. Praec. 2.819f; help to excite, Luc. Dom. 4; συνεξαρθεὶς τοῖς λόγοις excited with the rest by . . , D.S. 17.72.

children.label: II
children.definition: rise together, of the sea, Str. 1.3.5; go out along with, τινι Id. 16.2.35; of colonists, Plb. 12.5.8.

children.label: III
children.definition: remove as well, in dissection, Gal. 2.699.
follow constantly, attend everywhere, συνεξακολουθεῖ τισι ὄνειδος Plb. 2.7.3, cf. 58.11; τὸ νικᾶν σφίσι σ. Id. 3.63.11, etc.; συνεξηκολούθει αὐτῷ ἀσέλγεια was habitual to him, Id. 36.15.4.
turn out in accordance with, τῇ βουλήσει τινός OGI 763.48 ( Milet., ii B.C.); ταῖς Ῥωμαίων προθέσεσι Plb. 18.32.12; τὸ σ. τούτοις their consequences, Id. 3.55.3.
Eust. 630.20, An.Ox. 1.97: hence Subst. συνεξακολούθησις, εως, ἡ, Eust. 630.21.
spurt out along with, τῇ ῥύσει τοῦ αἵματος Eust. 1108.3.
hear all together at the same time, S. Tr. 372; τινων Plu. QConv. 2.720d.

children.label: II
children.definition: understand as implied in a thing, S.E. M. 7.241, Eust. 769.58, etc.
help to sack, BCH 21.599 ( Delph., iv B.C.).
abolish also, in Pass., Plu. Cat.Mi. 17, Gal. 11.10.
permute, Dam. Pr. 36.
change at the same time, Gal. 17 (1).42, Simp. in Ph. 320.22.
leap out along with, τινι Eust. 837.26.
err along with, share in a fault, Th. 3.43, Lys. 3.12, etc.; τισι with them, Isoc. 6.19, D. 61.19, Chrysipp. Stoic. 2.38, etc.; μετά τινος Antipho 5.76; σ. τοῖς Αἰτωλῶν ἀσεβήμασιν Plb. 5.11.1.
exchange at the same time, τόπους ἄλλους δεσπόταισιν ἐκδήμοις Babr. 59.15.
struggle jointly with, c. dat., Plu. Sanit. 2.137d.
to be exhausted together with, τοῖς χρήμασι D.H. 4.23.
fill up again with or together, Hp. Anat. 1.
blossom or break out together, Plu. Def.orac. 2.434b.
to be relaxed together with, συνεξανίεται [τῇ ψυχῇ] τὸ σῶμα Sor. 1.25.
stir up or excite together, Plu. Aud. 2.44c.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., with aor. 2 and pf. Act., rise and come forth with, Id. Ages. 12; to be roused to action or ready for action with or together, ἅμα τισί Id. Pyrrh. 11; πρός τι Id. Dem. 18, Cat. Mi. 59; σ. τοῖς καιροῖς Plb. 16.9.4.
rise in rebellion, revolt along with or together, Id. 5.39.4, etc.; τινι D.C. 71.27.
to be in enthusiastic sympathy with, τούτῳ ταῖς ὁρμαῖς, of the crowd at a wrestling-match, Plb. 27.9.3.
help one to open a way, c. dat., v.l. in J. BJ 5.2.2.

definition: συνεξανύω, D.Chr. 12.43, also συνεξ-ᾰνύτω [ῠ], J. BJ 5.2.2, Plu. Sanit. 2.137d, Aet.Gr. 298a:—

children.definition: accomplish together, D.Chr. l.c.; join in achievement, Plu. Sanit. 2.137d.

children.label: II
children.definition: equal in running, Aet.Gr. ib. 298a; reach safety together with, c. dat., J. l.c. (v.l. -ανοίγειν).
deceive together or also, D. 23.159:— Pass., Id. 16.2, Str. 14.1.24; ὁ Συνεξαπατῶν, name of a play by Bato.
send forth together, Plb. 8.19.6, D.S. 14.20:— Pass., fut. -στᾰλήσομαι, go out with, ἅμα τινί Plb. 22.14.11.
set on fire, Plu. Def.orac. 2.433d, Fac.lun. 929c; τὸν ἔρωτα Hld. 7.9; ψυχὴν τῷ νῷ Procl. Inst. 129:— Pass., M.Ant. 9.9.
reckon in or besides, Inscr.Délos 372 A 107 (iii/ii B.C.):— Pass., ἔν τισι D.S. 15.53, J. BJ 3.4.2.
suffice, Str. 14.1.41.
join in leading, δήμῳ Pl. Ax. 368d.
cause to evaporate together, τὸ ὑγρόν Arist. Mete. 382b20.
evaporate, Id. GA 752a35, 783a17, PA 650b18.
lose tension or vigour together with, τὸ πρόσωπον τῇ ψυχῇ σ. Plu. Vit.pud. 2.528e.
to be roused together, Plb. 4.47.3.
go out along with or together, μετά τινων Th. 3.113; τινι X. Cyr. 1.4.15, Arist. Mete. 388b14, etc.; ἅμα τισί J. BJ 2.2.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: pass away together, [ νοῦσος] τῷ κάλλεϊ σ. τῆς ὥρης Aret. SD 1.4.

data.quote: νοῦσος] τῷ κάλλεϊ σ. τῆς ὥρης

children.definition: drive out along with or together, τινὰ πατρί A. Ag. 1606; βοίδιον βουσί AP 9.715 ( Anacr.).
fellow-freedman, BGU 1141.20 (i B.C.). PSI 5.473.2 (ii A.D.), IG 3.1434, D.C. 60.15: fem. συνεξελευθέρα, Perdrizet Mélanges d’arch. et d’hist. 25.82 ( Salonica, i A.D.).
to be unrolled together, χαλκὸς . . πλοκαῖς σ. follows all the curls, Callistr. Stat. 11.
to be formed by derivation, παραγωγαῖς A.D. Pron. 92.2.
vomit out also, Arist. HA 547a27:— Pass., Antyll. ap. Orib. 8.5.1.
destroy together, τινάς τισι Aristid. 1.412J.
inflame together, only in 3 sg. aor. opt. Pass. -ερευθείη, Hp. Prog. 23 (with many vv.ll.), Coac. 359.
examine thoroughly with, in aor. Med., Pl. Tht. 155e.
draw off along with, AP 6.57 ( Paul.Sil.).
go or come out with, c. dat., Hdt. 5.74, E. Hec. 1012, Th. 8.61, X. HG 3.4.2.
Hp. Nat.Hom. 14, Arist. HA 587a17, GA 783a36, Gal. 18(1).135.
come out or result in identity with, τινι S.E. M. 7.421.

search out and examine along with or together, Pl. Lg. 900d, Ph. 2.197, Iamb. Comm. Math. 14:— Pass., to be reckoned with or among, οἱ συνεξεταζόμενοι μετά τινος or τινι his party or adherents, D. 21.127,190, cf. Luc. Pr. Im. 15; but also συνεξετάζεσθαί τινι measure oneself with one, rival him, Alciphr. 3.54.
fellow-investigator, Procl. in Prm. p.529 S.

definition: συνεξευπορέω or συνεξευπορίζω, f.l. for συνεκπορίζω in X. An. 5.8.25: fut. inf. -ήσειν Iamb. Comm.Math. 34: aor. inf. -ῆσαι Procl. in R. 2.96 K.

children.definition: assist in finding out, τινα Ar. Th. 601; πάντα Isoc. 4.47; τινὶ τὰς ὗς join him in finding out, D.H. 3.70; σ. ὅπως . . σωθήσεσθε E. Heracl. 420; σ. ὅ τι πρακτέον εἴη Jul. Or. 3.114b.
indicate, explain at the same time, A.D. Pron. 37.18, Synt. 73.19, Gal. 17(1).596.
to be civilized together, ὁ δῆμος ἅμα τῇ χώρᾳ σ. Plu. Num. 16.
heal together, τὰς ὀδύνας Gal. 10.820.
sweat out together, συνεξιδρῶσαι δυσώδη evil-smelling when exuded with the perspiration, Arist. Pr. 908b34.
exude or throw off together, ἄλλα περιττώματα μετὰ τοῦ ἱδρῶτος Arist. Pr.883b28, cf. Thphr. Sud. 13.
coincide, κατὰ τὸ εὖρος τῷ μήκει Procop. Aed. 5.5, cf. 1.1.
ride away together, Memn. 34 (v.l. συνεπισπασαμένοις).

definition: συνεξισάζω, = sq., Dexipp. in Cat. 6.7, Simp. in Cat. 213.4.

children.definition: equalize, τοῖς μεγέθεσι τοὺς λόγους D.H. Pomp. 5:— Pass., Id. 10.16, D.S. 2.10, IG 12(2).58b7 (Mytil.).
make common cause with, Plb. 3.34.9, 3.68.8, 5.39.4.
to be strong enough to, c. inf., Olymp. in Mete. 31.21.
trace out along with, τινί τι Plu. Cic. 18.
go out along with, τινι Satyr. 3.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be carried in a procession ( ἐξοδεία), OGI 90.42 ( Rosetta, ii B.C.).
smell of a thing besides, Thphr. Od. 60.
swell up together, Gal. 18(1).44.
alienate jointly, PRyl. 118.15 (i B.C.).
run aground together, c. dat., App. BC 5.121: metaph., Plu. Sollert. 2.985c.
slip out along with, Man. 5.43, in aor. -ώλισθεν.
swear jointly in the negative, GDI 4986.18 ( Crete).

assimilate, make similar, τί τινι Plu. Stoic.rep. 2.1054b; τὰ ἤθη ib. Fort. 97a; ἑαυτῇ τὸ σπέρμα Gal. UP 14.7; suit, accommodate, τὸ . . σχῆμα τοῖς λόγοις Herm. in Phdr. p.76 A.:— Pass., to become or be like, Thphr. CP 1.9.3, Fr. 173, Plb. 31.18.4, Placit. 1.6.1; κακίᾳ καὶ φθόνῳ Vett.Val. 304.27; συνεξομοιοῦται τὰ τρεφόμενα ταῖς τρεφούσαις Sor. 1.88; τῷ περιέχοντι συνεξομοιοῦσθαι become assimilated, Plb. 4.21.1.
complete assimilation, πρὸς τοὺς τόπους Eust. 1541.39.
excite together, φόβῳ (s.v.l.) Plu. Es. carn. 2 2.998e.
banish together, Sch. E. Ph. 1679 ( Pass.).
help to urge on, Isoc. 10.52; τὰ ζῷα πρὸς τοὺς συνδυασμούς Plu. QConv. 2.685e; ὁ ἥλιος σ. τὰ πνεύματα assists in raising them, Arist. Mete. 361b14.

children.label: II
children.definition: rush forth or sally out together, X. Cyr. 1.4.20 (v.l. ἐξορμᾷ), 7.1.29, Hell.Oxy. 15.3, Plb. 10.37.6; ὕλη συνεξορμᾷ τῷ σίτῳ shoots up along with the corn, X. Oec. 17.12, 14:— Pass., D.C. 41.9.
set out together, ἅμα ἡμῖν Arch.Pap. 2.515.8 (i B.C.), cf. PTeb. 18.8 (ii B.C.).
rush out with, τῷ κύματι Clearch. 73.
Nic.Dam. Fr. 66.16 J., Them. Or. 21.256a.
discharge with the urine, Hp. Aph. 4.77, Gal. 8.84 (both Pass.).
fellow-magistrate, Sammelb. 343.
moisten with or together, Plu. Amat. 2.752d.
praise loudly together, Them. Or. 8.102b.

drive out together, ἱδρῶτα Hp. Vict. 2.66; puff out, [ τὴν φιλοτιμίαν] Plu. Praec. 2.820a; σ. αὐτὸς ἑαυτὸν ἐπὶ τὴν γῆν ib. Sollert. 984f; τινὰ ἐκ τοῦ ζῆν ib. Col. 1110e; συνοδίαν εἰς τὰς φάραγγας Str. 4.6.6; dismiss at the same time, Lib. Or. 18.131.
beautify together, Eust. 1598.49.

definition: συνέορσις, ἡ, f.l. in Plu. Virt.mor. 2.449a (pl.); prob. συνθροήσεις.

children.definition: join in keeping festival, D.S. 4.4, CIG 2820.19 ( Aphrodisias), POxy. 1025.12 (iii A.D.); ἡμῖν with us, Plu. QConv. 2.666d, cf. Arr. Epict. 4.1.104; τῇ μητρὶ ἐπιτελούσῃ τοὺς ἀγῶνας SIG 798.12 (Cyzic., i A.D.); σ. γάμους τινί D.C. 59.8; τὰ προοίμια τῆς παλιρροίας Them. Or. 14.181a.
sharer in a festival, Pl. Lg. 653d.
joining, joint, κεφαλῆς τε καὶ αὐχένος ἐν συνεοχμῷ Il. 14.465.

data.quote: κεφαλῆς τε καὶ αὐχένος ἐν συνεοχμῷ

children.definition: lead together against, ἐπί τινας Th. 3.11.

join in bringing in against another, of those who call in a foreign force to aid them, Id. 4.1, 79, 84:— Med., bring or take with one, τὸν ἀδελφόν IG 12(3).174.16 (Cnidus, Epist. Aug.), cf. BGU 1780.6 (i B.C.), J. AJ 18.9.5, Plu. Cat.Ma. 17, D.C. 41.7; draw a net along with one, Ael. NA 14.29, cf. Gal. 11.508: metaph., τὰ ἐπιρρήματα σ. τὴν πρόθεσιν ἐπὶ τὰ ῥήματα A.D. Synt. 338.4.

data.quote: τὰ ἐπιρρήματα σ. τὴν πρόθεσιν ἐπὶ τὰ ῥήματα

children.definition: join in stirring up a contest besides, τοῖς γεγονόσι besides all that had happened, Plb. 3.118.6.
join in celebrating, συνεπαείδετʼ Ἄρτεμιν E. IA 1492 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: sing spells or charms at the same time, συνεπᾴδειν ἐπῳδήν Thphr. HP 9.10.4.

approve together, give joint assent, consent, approve, πόλις καὶ τὸ δίκαιον ξ. A. Th. 1079 (anap.), cf. X. Cyr. 4.3.23 (v.l.), D. 18.179: c. inf., ξ. μάχεσθαι join in the recommendation to fight, Th. 4.91, cf. X. Cyr. 5.3.34; σ. τι approve, consent or agree to, Id. An. 7.3.36, Pl. Hp.Mi. 363a; σ. τινὶ ὅ τι ἂν πράττῃ agree with one in all that he does, D. Prooem. 28.

children.label: II
children.definition: join in praising, τινα X. Eq.Mag. 5.14 codd., Pl. Mx. 246a:— Pass., Arist. Rh. 1415b28.

joining in approbation of a thing, σ. εἶναι or γίνεσθαι give oneʼs consent to a thing, τινι Hdt. 3.119, 5.31: abs., ib. 20, Nic.Dam. Fr. 130.18 J.: c. acc. et inf., consent that . . , Hdt. 7.15: c. dat. pers., D.C. 57.15.

raise or lift at the same time, ἑαυτόν X. Eq. 7.2; τὰ πρόσθια σκέλη Arist. HA 576b27:— Pass., swell at the same time, Gal. 18(2).266; to be elevated together, ἡ λέξις τῷ μεγέθει τῶν λεγομένων σ. Luc. Hist.Conscr. 45, cf. Procl. Inst. 209.

children.label: II
children.definition: urge on together or also, c. inf., X. Smp. 8.24, Oec. 5.5:— Pass., rise together with, τοῖς δημαγωγοῖς, of the rabble, Plu. Cor. 12, cf. J. BJ Prooem. 2.

children.label: III
children.definition: συνεπαιρομένου σὺν τῷ αἵματι καὶ τοῦ μοχθηροῦ χυμοῦ being carried to (the foetus) with the blood, Aët. 9.22.
feel together, Gal. UP 9.11.
consciousness, apperception, Epicur. Nat. 20 G.
accuse also of a thing, Μηδισμοῦ ξ. καὶ τὸν Θεμιστοκλέα Th. 1.135; Λακωνισμοῦ σ. τινάς Plu. Per. 10: abs., Id. Them. 23.
continue soaring over, Plu. Alex. 33.

follow closely, accompany, Pl. Phd. 81e, Plu. Alex. 41; τινι Str. 8.6.22; Νεῖλος συνεπηκολούθηκα I Nilus have been present too (at the transaction), PFay. 43.4 (i B.C.), cf. PLond. 2.256 ( e). 3 (i A.D.); of things, Hp. Oss. 4, Ocell. 2.22, Sor. 1.31, etc.
fellow-huntsman, Eust. 1688.24.
join in raising the war-cry, τινι J. BJ 4.5.1.
join in repelling, Th. 6.56.

children.label: II
children.definition: join in assisting, τινι App. BC 3.32.
return at the same time, c. dat., Them. Or. 15.197c.
join in a revolt or rebellion, Hdt. 3.84, Th. 1.132, OGI 218.118 ( Ilium, iii B.C.); τινι with one, Hdt. 3.61; ἅμα τινί Id. 1.59; αὐτοῖς μεθʼ ὑμῶν against them with you, D.H. 6.74.
join in re-establishing, l.c., Plb. 30.20.4.
succour together, Eust. 40.25.
join in training, making efficient, Aristid. 1.452 J. (dub.l.).
help to increase, τοῖς θεοῖς τὴν πανήγυριν IG 12(5).129.58 ( Paros, ii B.C.), cf. SIG 695.75 ( Magn. Mae., ii B.C.), 601.23 ( Teos, ii B.C.), Gal. UP 4.7, al., D.C. 39.25.
throw upon together, J. BJ 3.7.28.
connexion of words or verses, D.H. Comp. 23 (v.l. συνέχεια), A.D. Synt. 41.25; acc. sg. συνεπ[ει]αν is dub. l. in Phld. Po. 2.28.
help to urge on, ἐπὶ τὸ κάκιον Hp. Epid. 1.8; ἐς τὸν κίνδυνον Aret. CA 1.4: abs., ib. 10, etc.: intr., hasten on, ib. 2.2:— Pass., in same sense, ib. 1.10.

children.label: II
children.definition: συνεπείγεσθαί τινι increase or grow with, Ael. NA 14.23.
join in attacking, μετʼ αὐτῶν ἄλλοις Th. 3.63.
great haste, Nicom. Harm. 1.
go upon together, τὴν σκηνήν Plb. 30.22.9.
introduce besides, Phot. Bibl. p.145 B.
rush in upon together, εἰς πόλιν ἅμα τινί Plu. Fab. 17.
flow in upon together, Corp.Herm. 9.2.
bring in as well, Vett.Val. 359.14, Syrian. in Metaph. 90.36:— Med., help to bring in, τὸν βάρβαρον τῇ Ἑλλάδι X. HG 6.5.43 (v.l. ἐπεισφέρεσθαι).
drink off together, ἅμα τινί AP 6.292 ( Hedyl., dub.l.).
extend or spread over together, τινί τι Aristaenet. 2.15:— Pass., Arist. Ph. 216b29, Gal. UP 14.14; expand with, Id. 2.562; extend or project against the enemy as well, Ael. Tact. 13.3.
to be made light with something, Ph. 2.513: metaph., to be relieved with, Orib. 8.30.1.
help to make light, i.e. assist in bearing, σ. τισὶ τὸν πόλεμον Hdt. 1.18.
mount upon together, σ. τοῖς καιροῖς, ταῖς ἀτυχίαις, pounce upon opportunities, etc., Plb. 20.11.7, 30.9.21.

children.label: II
children.definition: σ. τινί join in trampling on him, Aristid. 1.471 J.
help in performing, Aristid. 2.175 J.

help in driving against, c. acc. rei, Plu. Fac.lun. 2.939b; help in inflicting, πληγήν Id. Brut. 52; σ. ὑπόνοιάν τινι help to fix a suspicion on him, Id. Caes. 8, cf. Cic. 21 (cj. for συναπ-); drive home a weapon, Id. Phil. 10; συνεπερείσας τῇ ῥύμῃ τοῦ ἵππου charging him with all the force of his horse, Id. Marc. 7; give additional force, Arr. Tact. 12.2, 10.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., = Lat. conitor, Dosith. p.433 K., Gloss.
contend also with, ποταμῷ AP 9.709 ( Phil.).
attack together, SIG 700.22 ( Macedonia, ii B.C.), PLips. 40 ii 5, 17 (iv A.D.).
consent, GDI 1785.2 ( Delph., ii B.C.).
help to direct or guide, ἀρχὰς πραγμάτων Plu. Rom. 7.
join in cheering or applauding, D.S. 1.72, 17.72.

join in prayer, Th. 6.32; pray also to, [ θεοῖς] συννάοις σ. Plu. QConv. 2.708c: c. acc. et inf., profess also that . . , Ar. Th. 951: c. inf. fut., make a vow also to . . , σ. τοῖς θεοῖς θύσειν X. An. 3.2.9.
refer together to a thing, Iamb. in Nic. p.8 P.

join in singing, join in a chorus, ἐξῆρχε παιᾶνα, οἱ δὲ πάντες συνεπήχησαν X. Cyr. 3.3.58, cf. 7.1.25; κορυφαίου κατάρξαντος σ. πᾶς ὁ χορός Arist. Mu. 399a15; συνεπήχουν πρὸς τὸ ἐνδόσιμον Max.Tyr. 7.7: metaph., chime in with, Ph. 1.321, Plu. Aud. 2.44c, Them. Or. 18.218a.

data.quote: ἐξῆρχε παιᾶνα, οἱ δὲ πάντες συνεπήχησαν
κορυφαίου κατάρξαντος σ. πᾶς ὁ χορός

children.label: II
children.definition: re-echo, οἶκος Luc. Dom. 3, cf. J. AJ 12.9.4, D.C. 66.22.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass., to be sounded at the same time, τῶν ἡμιφώνων τι -εφηχεῖται (sic) Phld. Po. 2.16.
mount together, Arist. HA 591b21; τοῦ τείχους on the wall, Plu. TG 4; mount a ladder together, Plb. 10.13.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: enter upon or undertake along with, τινι Antipho 2.2.13.

children.label: III
children.definition: trample on as well, σ. ἐν ταῖς συμφοραῖς τινι J. BJ 1.24.8.

children.label: IV
children.definition: aor. 1 part. -βήσας, cause to mount, πύργοις ἀκοντιστάς ib. 3.7.30.
apply oneʼs mind also, consider a thing together or also, Arist. Fr. 29, Plb. 3.38.4, S.E. M. 7.348: folld. by indirect question, M.Ant. 3.11.

data.ref: S.E. M. 7.348: folld. by indirect question,

children.label: II
children.definition: coincide with, καιροῖς Plb. 2.56.4.
to be damaged together with, τινι Arist. Pol. 1270b15.
regard at the same time, Antip.Stoic. 3.256; consider as well, Gal. 9.498.
come to aid together, Plb. 4.69.4, Gal. 8.16, Pall. in Hp. 2.116, 128 D.
join in plotting, X. HG 5.4.22, D.S. 5.50, etc.; τινὶ μετά τινος Is. 6.55, D.H. 3.29, etc.
fellow-plotter, J. AJ 18.6.6.
encourage, hearten, τὸ φιλότιμον, τὸ γενναῖον, Plu. QConv. 2.746d, 796 a.
laugh at together, Ammon. Diff. p.56 codd. ( ἐπιγελᾶν Valck.).
come on together, of troops, Plb. 10.38.10; of fevers, D.S. 32.10; occur as well, αἴτια κακῶν Vett.Val. 222.34.
fellow-registrar, fellow-clerk, Isoc. 17.41.
written consent, POxy. 273.23 (i A.D.), 2134.26 (ii A.D.).

inscribe together with other writing, PMag.Lond. 121.421; indicate as joint author, τύχην κατορθώμασι Plu. Praec. 2.816e; ἑαυτὸν σ. τοῖς πραχθεῖσι Gal. 11.202:— Pass., to be named jointly as auctor of a decree of the Senate, Notiz.Arch. 4.21.75 (Cyrene, Aug.); οἱ -γραφέντες μοι μάρτυρες named jointly with me as witnesses, Mitteis Chr. 28.24 (iii B.C.), cf. PStrassb. 87.14 (ii B.C.), FOxy. 265.16 (i A.D.):— Med., subscribe, assent, c. dat., Hipparch. 1.3.1, Phld. Rh. 1.374 S., Ph. 1.464: abs., Id. 2.311.
display at the same time, Plb. 33.5.1, Iamb. Myst. 2.7:— Pass., to be indicated together, Plb. 3.38.5, Gal. 9.420, 18(2).100.
bind up together, Sor. 1.84.
bandage as well, Hp. Off. 24, Gal. 18(1).806.
travel to a place together, Str. 15.1.2; -ησάντων τῇ κιβωτῷ τῶν δεινῶν the plagues having visited them with the ark, J. AJ 6.1.2.

give up wholly or willingly, ἑαυτόν τινι or εἴς τι Plb. 31.24.5, 32.5.10; ἐς πάντα τὰ καλῶς ἔχοντα ἑαυτόν Supp.Epigr. 4.601.8 ( Teos, ii B.C.), cf. 3.468.16 (Thess., i B.C.); τῇ Κλωθοῖ σεαυτόν M.Ant. 4.34; simply, συνεπέδωκε αὐτοσαυτὰν ἁ σύνοδος SIG 698.6 ( Delph., ii B.C.); τὰ σώματα προκινδυνεῦσαι D.H. 3.15, cf. Inscr.Prien. 109.156 (ii B.C.).

data.quote: ἐς πάντα τὰ καλῶς ἔχοντα ἑαυτόν

children.definition: join in presenting an application, PAmh. 2.85.24 (i A.D.), Sammelb. 7363.25 (ii A.D.), etc.
offer together, τὴν χεῖρά τινι Them. Or. 7.90a.

children.label: II
children.definition: increase along with or together, Plu. Virt.mor. 2.448d.
to be closely connected with, συνεπεζεῦχθαί τινι Phld. Ir. p.66W.
examine along with, τινί τι Aristaenet. 2.3.
ascribe to divine interposition, Plu. Sull. 6; σ. τὸ χρηστήριον recognize it as divine, Id 2.409c.
joint assault, Aq. Ps. 118(119).118.
abettor, BGU 984.23 (iv A.D.).
contemplate at the same time, S.E. M. 7.46.
help to sharpen or stimulate, Plu. Def.orac. 2.433d.
exert pressure at the same time, Gal. 8.15.
join in applauding loudly, Plu. Vit.pud. 2.531c.
join in bewailing, Plu. Adul. 56a, M.Ant. 7.43; τοῖς ἀβουλήτοις Plu. Laud. 2.541a.
joint bewailing, Plu. Cons.ux. 2.610b (pl.).
participation in luxury, Plu. Suav. 1092d (pl.).
desire along with, σοι τῶν καλῶν X. Eq.Mag. 1.8.
one of the same desires, Pl. Clit. 408c.
halloo so as to cheer on together, Plu. Amat. 2.757d.
set on fire together, ἅμα Thphr. CP 5.17.6.
invoke together with, τινά τινι Arr. An. 6.3.1.
join in attacking, Ar. Eq. 266.
weigh upon, -κειμένων μου τῇ ψυχῇ κακῶν Phld. Rh. 2.139S.
encourage by consent, PLond. 3.1204.17 (ii B.C.), PStrassb. 84.19 (ii B.C.), PGrenf. 2.26.24 (ii B.C.).
mix with besides, Procl. Par.Ptol. 207:— Pass. -κίρνασθαι Vett.Val. 5.

definition: συνεπικλάω, break or bow down at once, metaph., τῆς αἰσθήσεως συνεπικλώσης τὴν διάνοιαν Plu. Phil. 9. -->

children.definition: incline at the same time, Gal. 6.151 ( Pass.), Dam. Pr. 168.
help to adorn, X. Hier. 8.6; τὸν λόγον Arist. Top. 157a11; τὸν βίον Id. EN 1100b26, cf. Phld. Mus. p.39K.:— Pass., prob. in OGI 470.23 ( Lydia, i A.D.).
fellow-Epicurean, Arr. Epict. 2.20.13.
help to succour, X. Hier. 3.2; ταῖς ἀπορίαις τινός Id. Cyr. 1.6.24; Astrol., join as ally, τῷ ἡλίῳ S.E. M. 5.32.
lighten at the same time, Plu. Cam. 25, Gal. 19.245.

children.label: II
children.definition: help in relieving, Ph. 2.364; raise aloft, metaph., τοῖς φρονήμασιν Plu. Eum. 9.
move backwards and forwards together with, σὺν ταῖς οὐραῖς τὰ σώματα, of dogs near game, X. Cyn. 6.16.
dominate together, Vett.Val. 293.15.
help to judge between, ἡμᾶς Pl. Lg. 792c.
help to decide a matter, Plu. Adul. 2.53b, Longin. 1.2, Plot. 2.1.6.
join in applauding, Plu. Adul. 2.56b, 63a.
help to conceal, Plu. Alc. 28, Tim. 10:— Med., Iamb. VP 34.245.
join in ratifying, δόγμα Plb. 4.30.2; τῷ δήμῳ τοὺς νόμους Plu. Caes. 14.
join in a κῶμος, Satyr. 1, S.E. M. 6.8.

take part with a person, λόγῳ καὶ ἔργῳ σ. τινί Th. 2.8; τοῦ βίου Max.Tyr. 14.7 [8.7.c]; πρὸς ἀσφάλειαν ἑκατέρῳ ἑκάτερος Id. 16.8 [10.8.g]: c. dat. rei, τῇ σωτηρίᾳ τῆς νεώς . . Id. 21.4 [15.4.e]: abs., assist, PPetr. 3p.57 (iii B.C.), Arr. An. 6.3.3, Gal. 6.212.
envelop also, τι τοῦ περὶ τὴν διάρθρωσιν συνδέσμου Id. 2.301, cf. 18(2).937.

data.quote: τι τοῦ περὶ τὴν διάρθρωσιν συνδέσμου

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., take part in together, partake in, c. gen. rei, τοῦ στρατεύματος, τοῦ πολέμου, Hdt. 3.48, 5.45, cf. Th. 8.26: abs., Id. 1.115, OGI 244.36 ( Daphne, iii/ii B.C.).

σ. τινί τινος take part with or assist one in a thing, σ. τινὶ τοῦ ἔργου Luc. Prom. 13, cf. Im. 8; σ. τισὶ σωτηρίας help them towards it, Plb. 11.24.8, etc.; σ. τισὶ τοῦ φόβου contribute towards increasing their fear, Th. 6.70: c. dat. pers. only, take part with, support, Id. 3.74, Plb. 5.90.2, etc.; συνεπιλαβοῦ (sc. αὐτῷ) ἵνα κομίσηται help him to recover (the money), PCair.Zen. 553.9 (iii B.C.); συνεπιλαβόμενος τοῦ ἐντυχεῖν αὐτὸν Ἀπολλωνίῳ τὴν ταχίστην PMich.Zen. 23.7 (iii B.C.).

data.quote: συνεπιλαβόμενος τοῦ ἐντυχεῖν αὐτὸν Ἀπολλωνίῳ τὴν ταχίστην

children.definition: τῶν Ἑλλήνων σ. help in (the persuasion of) the Greeks, Plu. Them. 12.
take also into consideration, Ptol. Phas. p.11 H.
help to brighten, τὸ φρόνημα Plu. An seni 2.795c.
illumine at the same time, Thphr. CP 4.4.13, Plot. 4.3.17.
utter in addition, τὸν λόγον τοῦτον PMag.Par. 1.1037.
Med., read over together, Hld. 10.13.
fail together with, Plot. 6.5.12, Iamb. VP 35.252.
one must further add, Eust. 1406.50.
calculate also, Ptol. Alm. 2.4, Procl. Par.Ptol. 121:— Pass., Ptol. Alm. 13.4.
one must also calculate or must reckon in, Ptol. Alm. 13.4, Eust. 366.34.
join in cancelling a mortgage, Delph. 3(2).233 (ii B.C.).

join in attesting, Arist. Mu. 400a15, Thphr. CP 6.16.6, Ep.Hebr. 2.4; τινι with one, Plb. 25.6.4, Aristeas 191, Plu. Laud. 2.542c, Gal. 15.583, Ath. 13.595e; add oneʼs evidence, Plu. Frat. 2.486c, Laud. 539d.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be also configurate, of planets, Nech. ap. Vett.Val. 279.3, Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.187.
joint testimony or approval, M.Ant. 1.10.
join, unite, μόλιβδον ἀργύρῳ Aristaenet. 1.10:— Pass., of veins, muscles, etc., Gal. 2.816, UP 7.11.
smile at together, τοῖς πάθεσι Plu. QConv. 2.672e.

join in taking care of or attending to, τινος Th. 8.39, X. Eq.Mag. 1.8, etc.; τῆς στρατιᾶς have joint charge of, Id. An. 6.1.22; σ. μεθʼ ἡμῶν προσήκει D. 48.5, cf. Arist. Ath. 49.3; συνεπιμέλεσθαι δὲ αὐτῷ καὶ τοὺς στρατηγούς IG 1(2).59.14, cf. 88.19; τοῦ ἀναθήματος . . τῇ βουλῇ -ήθησαν Ἀρχ.Ἐφ. 1917.41 (Attic decree, iv B.C.): abs., X. Mem. 2.8.3; συνεπιμεληθῆναι ὅπως καταστῶσιν Pl. Lg. 754c; ὅπως ἂν τάχιστα τυθῇ IG 1(2).39.68; ὅπως τι ληφθῇ PCair.Zen. 217.6 (iii B.C.), cf. IG 2(2).678.14; σ. ἵνα . . OGI 214.24 ( Milet., iii B.C.).

data.quote: συνεπιμέλεσθαι δὲ αὐτῷ καὶ τοὺς στρατηγούς

children.definition: fellow-curator, coadjutor, X. Cyr. 5.4.17, IG 2(2).1317.2 (both pl.).
assign at once, at the same time, Eust. 100.4, 828.12 (both Pass.).

children.label: II
children.definition: contribute also (stellar influence), Vett.Val. 178.25.
one must construe also, τὸ . . μάλα εἰς . . Eust. 1769.64.
join in assenting, Arist. SE 169a33, IPE 2.52 ( Panticapaeum, i A.D.), Wilcken Chr. 14 ii 13 (i A.D.), Plu. Adul. 2.53b; ἐξ ὅλης τῆς ψυχῆς ταῖς ἡδοναῖς σ. ib. Virt.mor. 446a.
join in granting, τίμαις ( Aeol. acc. pl.) IGRom. 4.1302.20 ( Cyme, i B.C. /i A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: gestures in accordance with his speech, Phld. Rh. 1.73S.
float on the surface together, Aristaenet. 1.3.
join in contriving, S.E. M. 8.161; σ. πῶς . . Plb. 8.15.2; devise as well, A.D. Synt. 103.27 ( Pass.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., to be included in the idea of a thing, c. dat., Phld. Vit. p.38J., Dam. Pr. 57: abs., to be taken into consideration or understood as well, Gal. 6.105, 11.5, 17(2).707.
one must understand also, Eust. 821.1.
join in swearing falsely, Plu. Praec. 2.808a.
feel emotion together, μετὰ πάθους τινός Plu. Stoic.rep. 1037b.
plait in with the rest, AP 4.2.13 ( Phil.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., metaph., τῇ ἀλόγῳ ψυχῇ τοῦ θηρίου -πλέκεται ἡ λογικὴ ἡ τοῦ ἀνθρώπου Herm. in Phdr. p.153A.

data.quote: τῇ ἀλόγῳ ψυχῇ τοῦ θηρίου -πλέκεται ἡ λογικὴ ἡ τοῦ ἀνθρώπου

children.definition: join in a naval expedition, D. 50.59.
association, φίλων Ptol. Tetr. 111, 181; of planets, Nech. ap. Vett.Val. 279.6.
help in extra work, X. Cyr. 5.4.17 (as v.l. for ἐπιπονεῖν).
march through together, OGI 12.15 ( Priene, iii B.C.).
incline towards together, Plu. Phoc. 2.
flow to together, Gal. 13.668, PGrenf. 2.69.19 (iii A.D.); σ. ὁ ὄχλος D.H. 10.16; extend in flow, ἔλαιον σ. πορρωτάτω Plu. QConv. 2.696d.
help to strengthen or support, τοὺς Ἕλληνας Plu. Alex. 33, cf. Brut. 49:— Pass., of language, to be based firmly at the same time on, τοῖς ὕψεσι Longin. 11.2.

help to indicate, τῇ τοῦ θεοῦ προνοίᾳ Plu. Pyth. 2.398a, cf. Gal. 19.188: mostly in Med., join in expressing a judgement of a thing (c. acc.), whether in disapproval, Plb. 4.24.4; or in approval, D.S. 17.25.
Med., explain: or interpret in addition, Gal. 17(1).600.
one must examine together, Ph. 2.335, Gal. 6.250.
protect at the same time, Ascl. Tact. 1.3 ( Pass.).
join in repairing. OGI 483.33 (Pcrgam., ii A.D.).
Med., work up in addition, Procl. Par. Ptol. 14.

definition: συνεπισκοπέω, fut. -σκέψομαι Pl. Cra. 422c: aor. -εσκεψάμην (v. infr.): non- Att. pres. συνεπι-σκέπτομαι, Gal. 6.827, 10.215, Ptol. Phas. Prooem. 8, Alex.Aphr. in Sens. 5.16: pres. Med. and Pass. συνεπισκοποῦμαι Gal. 6.256, 10.662, 2.681:—

children.definition: join in examining, examine or consider together with, ἀλλά μοι τόδε συνεπίσκεψαι Pl. Hp.Ma. 296b; συνεπίσκεψαι μετʼ ἐμοῦ Id. Cra. 422c; ἐκ τῶν ἀπορουμένων λόγων συνεπισκεψάμενοι Arist. MM 1200b22; συνεπισκοπεῖν καὶ τὰ ὑπʼ ἐκείνου λεχθέντα Str. 8.3.23; ταῦτα συνεπισκόπει καὶ αὐτός Plu. Profect. 2.83e, cf. QConv. 714c; συνεπισκέψασθε ᾗ . . Pl. Ap. 27a.

data.quote: συνεπισκοπεῖν καὶ τὰ ὑπʼ ἐκείνου λεχθέντα

children.definition: look sternly at with or together, Plu. QConv. 2.672e.
draw on together, βίᾳ σ. τὸν ἡνίοχον εἰς τὸ ῥεῖθρον Plu. Crass. 19.

data.quote: βίᾳ σ. τὸν ἡνίοχον εἰς τὸ ῥεῖθρον

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., draw on along with one, esp. to ruin, τοὺς φίλους Pl. R. 451a, cf. D. 19.224, IPE 12.352.23 ( Chersonesus, ii B.C.); of things, involve, bring on, κακά Phld. Ir. p.23W., cf. p.77W.; also without any bad sense, Pl. Ti. 44a, X. Cyr. 2.2.24: literally, of the magnet, σ. τὸν σίδηρον Epicur. Fr. 293; of ligaments, ἑαυτοῖς σ. τοὺς σπονδύλους Gal. 18(1).506.

data.ref: X. Cyr. 2.2.24: literally, of the magnet,

children.definition: draw on along with one, i.e. to oneʼs own views, τινὰ πρὸς τὸ συμφῆσαι Pl. Sph. 236d; πρὸς τὴν αὑτῶν γνώμην Plb. 30.6.7:— Pass., Epicur. Nat. 121 G.
σ. τὸν ἀέρα inhale at the same time, Arist. Pr. 906a

definition: συνεπισπεύδω, join in forcing onward, τὰς ἁμάξας X. An. 1.5.8. -->

children.definition: to be privy to, τὴν ἐπανάστασιν X. HG 5.4.19; ἀπιστότατον ἔργον σ. μοι πεποιηκότι Gorg. Pal. 21; σ. τινὶ πονηρὰ δράσαντι Luc. Cat. 23, cf. 27; οὐδὲν ἐμαυτῷ ψεῦδος εἰπόντι σ. Id. VH 2.31, cf. Cal. 9; ἃ ἐμαυτῷ συνεπίσταμαι LXX Jb. 19.27.
know perfectly well or fully, πολλάκις ἑώρακα . . τὸν ἥλιον καὶ σελήνην δρῶντας ταῦθʼ ἃ ἀεὶ πάντες συνεπιστάμεθα Pl. Lg. 821c; οὐκ ἄρα συνεπίστανται ὅτι ἐπίστανται; Arist. SE 177a27.

data.quote: πολλάκις ἑώρακα . . τὸν ἥλιον καὶ σελήνην δρῶντας ταῦθʼ ἃ ἀεὶ πάντες συνεπιστάμεθα

children.definition: joint attention, Iamb. VP 31.188.
act as a joint supervisor, Pl. R. 528c; -ούντων τῷ ἔργῳ οἱ ταμίαι IG 1(2).92.39 (dub.); -ήσω ἐγὼ πᾶσι τούτοις will jointly supervise all these works, PCair.Zen. 34.22, cf. 574.5 (iii B.C.).
authorize at the same time, BGU 1741.8 (i B.C.), POxy. 1024.6 (ii A.D.); send with or together, Luc. Sat. 15.
groan at or over together, Epict. Ench. 16; ταῖς ἀλγηδόσιν Diog.Oen. 61.
sharing in knowledge, Zonar. s.v. συνίστωρ.
join in making war, τινι Th. 5.48, D. 5.16, etc.
turn at the same time, τοῦ ἀτράκτου τὴν περιφοράν Pl. R. 617c:— Pass., -ομένου τοῦ ἄξονος Heliod. ap. Orib. 49.9.27; of one being massaged, Gal. 6.177.
help to make attentive, Plu. Num. 14; πρὸς ἑαυτοὺς τὸν ἀκροατήν turn towards them also, Id. Laud. 2.542c, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: twist together like strands, Pl. Ti. 84d:— Pass., πρὸς ἓν τέλος συνεπιστρέφεσθαι τοῖς ἤθεσιν to be intertwined in their characters with a view to . . , Plu. Comp.Lyc.Num. 4.

children.label: III
children.definition: turn jointly towards, πρὸς ἀλλήλας Id. Num. 13.
join in misrepresenting, cavilling at, τινας dub. l. in Plu. Suav. 2.1096e.
draw to oneself together, Archig. ap. Aët. 12.1; draw with oneself, Gal. UP 8.7.
kill besides, Parth. 6.6 (s.v.l.).
seal or approve together, in Med., PRev.Laws 42.19, 84.2 (iii B.C.).

join in supporting, assist, X. Mem. 2.4.6; τισι LXX 2 Ch. 32.3, Plb. 6.6.10, etc.; κατά τινων Id. 6.8.1; ταῖς πλεονεξίαις αὐτῶν Id. 28.5.5; σ. μοι ἀπαιτοῦντι BGU 1189.14 ( i B.C. /i A.D.); αὐτοῖς ἀντεχομένοις ib. 1795.9 (i B.C.), cf. PSI 10.1160.9 (i B.C.); τοὺς ἄρχοντας συνεπισχύειν τοῖς ἀγορανόμοις, ὅπως . . SIG 799.19 ( Cyzicus, i A.D.), cf. IG 2(2).1013.6.

data.quote: τοὺς ἄρχοντας συνεπισχύειν τοῖς ἀγορανόμοις, ὅπως . .

children.definition: combine energy, of planetary influence, Vett.Val. 107.14.
σ. πρὸς <τὸν> τοῦ κάμνοντος κίνδυνον contribute to . . , Gal. 17(1).628.
joint exertion, Iamb. VP 16.69.
join in hastening, Plu. Agis 7; τὴν κίνησιν Id. QPlat. 2.1005a.
help to strain or intensify, αὐτῶν τὴν ὀργήν Plb. 3.13.1; τὴν ψυχρότητα Plu. QConv. 2.691c, etc.:— Pass., to be increased along with, τινι ib. An.procr. 1020c: abs., Herod.Med. ap. Aët. 9.37.
agree in intensity with, τινι Arist. Insomn. 460b13, v.l. in Plu. Virt.mor. 2.451d.
help to accomplish, Arist. Mete. 379b23 ( Pass.), Plu. Per. 13.
join in performing, παιᾶνα θεῷ X. Ages. 2.17.
rise together with, Autol. 2.11, Gem. 17.26, Adam. Vent. 42.
abridge in accordance with, Eust. 1167.61 ( Pass.).
help in putting on, put on still more, βάρος Plu. QConv. 2.728c.

children.label: II
children.definition: Med., join in attacking, τῷ Μήδῳ Th. 3.54, cf. 6.17; τῷ τῆς τύχης πταίσματι Phld. Vit. p.21J.; μετά τινος Th. 1.23, 6.10, Pl. Phlb. 16a: abs., X. Cyr. 4.2.3, Is. 6.29, Arist. Pol. 1311b17, LXX De. 32.27, Act.Ap. 24.9.
σ. τῷ ἔργῳ fall to the work together, Th. 6.56.
set upon and use to oneʼs own advantage, σ. τῇ ἀγνοίᾳ, τῷ μίσει τινός, Plb. 6.43.4; τοῖς καιροῖς Id. 3.15.10, 5.87.2.
σ. τισὶ ἁμαρτίαν lay a sin to their charge, LXX Nu. 12.11.
join in chiding, Plu. Lys. 15.
join in permitting, τινὶ ποιεῖν τι Epist. ap. J. AJ 16.6.7.
to be correspondingly cursory, Sch. Il. 7.256 (in An. Par. 3.10).
destroy at once or utterly, πάντα X. An. 5.8.20.
act as joint guardian over, τὰ τῇδε τῷ θεῷ Olymp. in Alc. p.60C., cf. IPE 2.52,53 ( Panticapaeum, i A.D.), POxy. 265.29 (i A.D.).
joint guardian, D. 27.14,16.
to be hurried along with, τῇ σπουδῇ τινος Eust. 1719.14.
help to make vain, Plu. Adul. 2.58b.
make perceptible at the same time, τὸν αὑτοῦ χυλόν (taste) Thphr. Od. 10:— Pass., appear together, Plu. Amat. 2.767c, Gal. 10.693, al.: c. dat., Plu. Isid. 2.353c, Gal. 16.839.
assent also, Plu. Adul. 2.63c.

carry with one, πίστιν D.H. Lys. 18; help to induce, τὰς τοιαύτας διαθέσεις Phld. Mus. p.6 K.; ὀλιγημέρους θανάτους Gal. 15.490; join in applying, ὄνομα Plu. Pomp. 2:— Med. in act. sense, Phld. Ir. p.80 W.:— Pass., συνεπενηνέχθαι τινί to be dragged in together with, Id. Po. 5.18; to be borne along with, ναῦς -φερομένας ταῖς τῶν πολεμίων τριήρεσι D.S. 13.45.

children.label: II
children.definition: carry along with it, i.e. imply, involve, τὸ πεζὸν καὶ τὸ δίπουν τὸ ζῷον Arist. Top. 144b17, cf. 157b23, APr. 52b7.

data.quote: τὸ πεζὸν καὶ τὸ δίπουν τὸ ζῷον

children.definition: assent, acquiesce, Plu. Garr. 2.511f.
reinforce oneʼs utterance, Plu. Tim. 27; ὁ αὐλὸς σ. τῷ παιᾶνι τὸ θεῖον sounds it with . . , Id. QConv. 2.713a.
help to load still more, Plu. QConv. 728c.
to be attached together with, Gal. 2.446, 18(2).975.
raise a shout of approval together, Aristeas 235, 294.
make an attempt together upon, πανταχόθεν ἅμα τοῖς πολεμίοις Plb. 3.84.1.
second by fresh violence, τοῖς παρανομήμασι D.S. 33.5 (prob. ἐπιχειρ-).
concur in, c. dat., IG 12(7).58.6 ( Arcesine, iii B.C.), Inscr.Délos 396 A 50, al. (ii B.C.).
join in lying, Call. Dian. 223, Luc. DMeretr. 13.5: c. acc., κλοπὴν οὐ γενομένην Ph. 2.341.
join in ratifying a law, σ. τὰ δόξαντα τοῖς γέρουσι Arist. Pol. 1272a11: abs., Plb. 21.32.1, SIG 893 A 11 ( Olympia, iii A.D., Med.).
help in rebuilding, IG 2(2).505.34 (iv B.C.).
put on land together, Plu. Symp. 2.161a.

definition: συνέπομαι, fut. -έψομαι Pl. Ti. 53c: aor. -εσπόμην (v. infr.):—

children.definition: follow along with, accompany, σὺν δʼ ὁ θρασὺς εἵπετʼ Ὀδυσσεύς (where however σύν may be an Adv.) Od. 10.436, cf. Hdt. 7.39, Th. 1.60, X. An. 3.1.2, etc.; σ. τινί A. Ag. 955, Hdt. 5.47, Thphr. Vent. 47, etc.; ποίμναις . . συνειπόμην used to follow the flocks, i.e. tend them, S. OT 1125; οὔ σοι τῷ βίῳ ξυνέσπετο (thy fortunes) remained not constant to thy life, ib. 1523 (troch.); ταῦρος ἄντυγι ξ. kept pace with, it, E. Hipp. 1231; τῷ χρόνῳ σ. Pl. Lg. 721c.

comply or be in accordance with, τῷ νόμῳ συνεπόμενος ib. 916d; τοῖς ἀποβαίνουσιν Arist. EN 1127a4; μετὰ δεδοκιμασμένου μὴ ξυνέπεσθαι ἐθέλειν Th. 3.38; τῇ τῶν μελιττῶν ἡδονῇ σ. ministering to the taste of the bees, Pl. Lg. 843d.

μουσικῇ συνεπόμεναι τέχναι the arts attendant on music, Id. Phlb. 56c; τὰ τούτοις συνεπόμενα the consequences of these, Id. Lg. 679e, cf. 706a, Ti. 52d: also c. gen., ὁπόσα τούτων συνεπόμενα εἴπομεν Id. Lg. 899c.
σ. τῷ λόγῳ follow the argument to its consequences, ib. 695c: abs., συνέπομαι I follow, i.e. understand, you, Id. Sph. 238e; συνέψεσθε Id. Ti. 53c.
swear to in addition or besides, τι Ar. Lys. 237: c. inf., X. An. 7.6.19:— Med., J. AJ 16.7.3.
view as an ἐπόπτης together, Them. Or. 20.235c.
consider, take into account also, Sor. 1.38.
join in urging on, S. El. 299 (tm.).
to be scarred quite over, Gal. 18(1).13.
scarring quite over, Arist. Pr. 865a31.
help onwards in oneʼs own course, metaph. from a fair wind, τὴν κίνησιν Arist. Cael. 301b29, cf. HA 598b9:— Pass., Id. Mech. 855a20.
folded or taken together, Ps.- Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 467.3.
sit on eggs together with, τῇ θηλείᾳ Arist. HA 555b14.
help to push on, τὸ σιτίον Plu. QPlat. 2.1005a, cf. Gal. Nat.Fac. 3.8; τὸ πορθμεῖον Plu. Lat.viv. 2.1128c; σ. ἡμᾶς ἐπί τι Arr. Epict. 3.7.23:— Med., Ph. 2.99.

definition: συνερανίζω, fut. -ίσω Plu. Sollert. 2.963b: pf. -ηράνικα Phld. Vit. p.24J.:—

children.definition: join in contributing, contribute jointly, τὰς χρείας ἀλλήλοις App. BC 2.9, cf. D.L. 4.38:— Med., receive contributions, Plu. Ages. 35.

children.label: II
children.definition: collect, gather, τινας Phld. l.c., Luc. Lex. 17; παραδείγματα Plu. Sollert. 2.963b:— Med., ὀλίγα ἐκ τῆς γραφῆς ῥήματα Them. Or. 21.252d:— Pass., αἱ . . ἐκ πλειόνων -ισμέναι δυνάμεις Ph. 1.386; συνηρανισμένον ἐκ συγκλύδων (v.l. σύγκλυδος) ὄχλου collected by chance contributions from . . , Pl. Ax. 369a, cf. D.H. Isoc. 3, S.E. M. 7.295, Gal. 14.676, 18(1).193.
gathering in, collecting, Plu. Bruta anim. 2.992a.
member of a club, IG 12(1).155.46 ( Rhodes), 22.2721.
one who is contributed (but does not contribute) to a picnic, of a parasite, Crobyl. 1 (Pors. for συνερανιστής).
joint lover, Timocl. 8.6; σ. τινῶν τῇ πόλει loving them jointly with . . , X. Smp. 8.41, cf. Plot. 5.8.10.
pour together, gather together, πολλὰ συνεράσας ᾠὰ εἰς κύστιν Arist. GA 752a4; συνερᾶν καὶ συμφέρειν, to explain ἔρανος, Ath. 8.362e: συνερασαι (sine accentu) is v.l. for συγκεράσαι in Isoc. 5.138.

love jointly or together with, σοὶ καὶ ξυνήρων E. Andr. 223; χρή σε . . μοι τὠραμένῳ συνερᾶν ἀδόλως σέθεν Theoc. 29.32; σύν μοι πῖνε, συνήβα, συνέρα Scol. 22, cf. Plu. Ages. 20, Alex. 41, Procop.Gaz. [Ecphr. 21] p.164 B.; ἡ Συνερῶσα, play by Menander.

data.quote: χρή σε . . μοι τὠραμένῳ συνερᾶν ἀδόλως σέθεν

children.label: II
children.definition: Med. and Pass., καλὸν δέ τʼ ἐρασσαμένῳ συνερᾶσθαι Bion Fr. 8.8 codd. ( συναρέσθαι is prob. cj.); ὅσα συνηράσθησαν what loves they had enjoyed together, D.C. 51.8.

work with, co-operate, l.c., Arist. GA 753a18, Thphr. Vent. 21; σ. πρός τι contribute towards or to a thing, X. Cyr. 7.1.33, Arist. Pr. 880b23, Thphr. Lass. 15; take part in a work of construction, IG 7.3073.21 ( Lebad., ii B.C.); εἰς ἐργάτην τὸν -αζόμενον αὐτῷ PCair.Zen. 176.23 (iii B.C.); σ. μετά τινος POxy. 527.3 (iii/ii A.D.); with neut. Adj., πολλά τισι ξυνειργασμένη Luc. Dem. Enc. 38, cf. Prom.Es 3; ὁ Συνεργαζόμενος, title of mime by Herodas.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀεὶ συνεργαζομένης [γῆς] . . ἐξαναχωρεῖν retires from land as it is brought under cultivation, Thphr. HP 6.3.3; γῆ συνεργασθεῖσα Id. CP 3.12.1; λίθοι ξυνειργασμένοι stones wrought so as to fit together, i.e. wrought for building, ashlar, Th. 1.93; ἐκ χρυσίου ξυνειργασμένος wrought of . . , Luc. Gall. 24; τοῦτο συνειργάσθη ἔργον was wrought, AP 9.807; συνεργασθεὶς ῥοδίνῳ ὁ ἄρτος (bread poultice) ἐπιπλάττεται Lycus ap. Orib. 9.26.1.
company or guild of fellow-workmen, ἡ σ. τῶν ἀργυροκόπων SIG 1263 ( Smyrna), cf. JHS 54.75 (ibid.), SIG 704 H 26 ( Delph., ii B.C.), OGI 495.6 ( Cibyra); ἡ τῶν γναφέων σ. IGRom. 4.643 ( Acmonia).

children.label: II
children.definition: a place where many slaves are lodged, a workers’ barracks, Lat. ergastulum, εἰς σ. ἐμβαλεῖν D.S. 20.13, 34/ 5.2.36.
fellow-workman, helpmate, πεμφθεὶς . . σοὶ ξ. S. Ph. 93; σκότος ξ. E. Hipp. 417: c. gen. rei, an accomplice or assistant in, ἄγρας Id. Ba. 1146; fem., συνεργ-άτις φόνου Id. El. 100.
composed of συνεργάται, σ. ἰχθυβόλων θίασος AP 7.295.10 ( Leon.).
to be joint-foreman, BCH 18.23 (Western Asia Minor).

work together with, help in work, co-operate, E. Hel. 1427, etc.; ἀλλήλοιν X. Mem. 2.3.18, cf. 2.9.8; μετʼ ἀλλήλων Arist. MM 1200a10: generally, co-operate with, assist, c. dat., D. 25.97, Thphr. Ign. 30, Od. 7, al., PSI 4.376.4 (iii B.C.), Sor. 1.27; σ. τῇ πράξει ὁ λόγος Muson. Fr. 5p.21H.; [ τὸ γυμνάσιον] ἀναδόσεσι σ. Gal. 6.88, cf. 463, 15.727; σ. ἑαυτοῖς τὰ συμφέροντα do one another fitting service, X. Mem. 3.5.16; εἰς τὰς εὐτυχίας Arist. EN 1171b23; εἰς τὴν ἐλευθερίαν τῇ πόλει IG 2(2).654.15, cf. Epicur. l.c., IPE 12.352.45 ( Chersonesus, ii B.C.), Sor. 1.56, M.Ant. 6.42; σφίσι πρὸς τοὺς καιρούς Plb. 3.97.5; σ. πρός τι contribute to or towards . . , Arist. MM 1185a35, Thphr. CP 4.8.3, Phld. Oec. p.43J., Gal. 15.419; σ. ὅπως . . Sor. 1.25; facilitate, τὸν δρασμὸν τοῖς Πέρσαις Hld. 9.11:— Pass., to be helped, c. dat. rei, D.H. 9.23; ὑπό τινος Phld. Rh. 1.224 S., Vit. p.24J., Plu. VOrat. 2.840c.
to be conspired against, PMich.Zen. 57.3 (iii B.C.).
assistance, support, Plb. 22.4.3: pl., Id. 2.42.4, 30.4.13; πρός τι Id. 3.99.9, cf. Phld. Mus. p.70 K., Rh. 2.83 S.; τὸ ἑκάστον ἀριθμοῦ σ., of the One, i.e. a factor in every number, Theol.Ar. 7.
working with, co-operating, Aristeas 242. Adv., -γῶς ἔχειν εἴς τι Phld. Oec. p.19 J.
one must assist, τῇ ἐκβολῇ Sor. 2.48, cf. Archig. ap. Gal. 12.676.
AP 7.693 ( Apollonid.).
co-operative, M.Ant. 6.42, Arr. Epict. 2.22.20: τὸ -κόν ib. 4.4.18.

co-operation, Arist. Pr. 876b15, Plb. 8.33.10; εἰς τὸν βίον, πρὸς τοὺς πολέμους, Phld. Rh. 1.270 S., Mus. p.69 K.: also συνέργεια, UPZ 36.14 (ii B.C.), Gal. 19.472: pl., Arist. Oec. 1343b17 ( -ίαι, v.l. -είαι).

children.label: II
children.definition: conspiracy, collusion, D. 56.8; περί τι Din. 1.112.
PMich.Zen. 57.2 (iii B.C.), IGRom. 3.810.9 ( Side), JHS 11.236 ( Cilicia), Gloss.; also συνέργ-ειον and σύνεργ-ιν, ib.
contracting for work in partnership with others, Str. 8.3.30.
implement, tool, Artem. 3.36, POxy. 1069.8 (iii A.D.), 1159.20 (iii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: trimmings, κιθωνίου Sammelb. 7250.11, cf. 7248.21 (iii/iv A.D.).
help in work or labour, ἡμῖν S.E. M. 9.41.

working together, joining or helping in work, and as Subst., ὁ, ἡ, helper, E. Or. 1446 (lyr.), Med. 396, Pl. Chrm. 173d, IPE 12.352.37 ( Chersonesus, ii B.C.); in bad sense, accomplice, Th. 8.92, PFay. 12.10 (ii B.C.), BGU 1761.8 ( i B.C., pl.): c. dat. pers., E. Hipp. 523, Th. 3.63, X. Cyr. 8.4.17, Pl. Smp. 180e, Men. Epit. 83; so metaph., σ. πλοῦτος . . κακίᾳ Teles p.46 H.; distd. from συναίτιον, Gal. 19.393: rarely c. gen. pers., ἡμῶν τι σ. (unless ἡμῶν is partit.) Epicur. Nat. 98 G.; θεοῦ 1 Ep.Cor. 3.9: c. gen. rei, taking part in a thing, σ. τείχεος helping to make it, Pi. O. 8.32; σ. τῶν ἐν τῷ κόσμῳ γινομένων Heraclit. 75; ξ. ἀδίκων ἔργων, ἀρετᾶς, helping towards them, E. Hipp. 676, Med. 845 (both lyr.); σ. τινί τινος helping a person in a thing, θρήνων ἐμοὶ (prob. for θρήνοις ἐμῶν) ξ. Id. Hel. 1112 (lyr.), cf. X. An. 1.9.21; σ. εἴς τι Id. Mem. 4.3.10, Smp. 8.38, Ep.Col. 4.11; πρός τι X. Mem. 4.3.7; πρὸς κακωδίαν Thphr. Sud. 8; πρὸς τὴν τῆς πόλεως σωτηρίαν Zeno Stoic. 1.61; ἐν μάχαις Ar. Eq. 588 (lyr.): c. inf., σ. τῷ παιδὶ μὴ ʼκπεσεῖν E. Ion 48.

data.quote: σ. τῶν ἐν τῷ κόσμῳ γινομένων

children.definition: in co-operation, of planetary influence, Vett.Val. 55.15; distd. from ὑπουργός, Serapio in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).226.

children.label: II
children.definition: person of the same trade as another, fellow-workman, colleague, c. gen. pers., D. 19.144, cf. IG 1(2).374.87, PCair.Zen. 758.8 (iii B.C.), Plu. Per. 31:—in this sense some write σύνεργος, Ammon. Diff. p.126 V., Thom.Mag. p.339R.

data.ref: Plu. Per. 31:—in this sense some write

children.definition: pres. first in Sor. 1.117: fut. συνέρξω (v. infr.): Ep. συνεέργω, impf. συνέεργον or συνεέργαθον: in later Att. συνείργνῡμι (q.v.): Att. aor. part. συνείρξας Gal. 4.495; 3 sg. aor. opt. συνείρξειε Plu. Pyth. 2.398b:— shut up or enclose together, ὅσον συνεέργαθον ἄκραι enclosed between them, Il. 14.36; οὐ ξυνέρξεθʼ ὡς τάχος; i.e. shut the doors, S. Aj. 593; οὐδὲ τὰς hοδὼς . . συνhέρξοντι Tab.Heracl. 1.133; wrap up closely, αὐτοὺς ἱματίοις Gal. l.c.
restrict, limit, τὸ πλῆθος τῆς σαρκός (obesity) Sor. l.c.

children.label: II
children.definition: fasten together, [ ὄϊας] συνέεργον . . λύγοισι Od. 9.427; συνέεργον ὁμοῦ τρόπιν ἠδὲ καὶ ἱστόν 12.424; ζωστῆρι . . συνέεργε χιτῶνα 14.72; unite, (sc. τινας) Pl. Ti. 34c; esp. as man and wife, Id. R. 461b.

data.quote: συνέεργον ὁμοῦ τρόπιν ἠδὲ καὶ ἱστόν

data.ref: Pl. Ti. 34c; esp. as man and wife,

children.definition: co-operate, help, S. El. 350; κειμένῳ οὐκ εἶ ξυνέρξων; Id. Tr. 83.

press together, close, χερσὶ κατʼ ὀφθαλμοὺς ἑλέειν σύν τε στόμʼ ἐρεῖσαι Od. 11.426; σ. ὀδόντας set the teeth, lock them fast, Hp. Coac. 230 (where συνερίζειν is f.l.), Mul. 2.201; bind together, bind fast, τινὰ περόναις E. Ba. 97 (lyr.):— Pass., αἱ γνάθοι συνερειδόμεναι being set or locked, Hp. Epid. 5.74; χέρας δεσμοῖς -ερεισθέντες with their hands tight bound, E. IT 457 (anap.), cf. Theoc. 22.68; διὰ τὸ μὴ σ. τὴν ἀρτηρίαν Arist. Aud. 801a2; χεῖρες ξυνηρεισμέναι arms flexed, Aret. SA 1.6.

data.quote: χερσὶ κατʼ ὀφθαλμοὺς ἑλέειν σύν τε στόμʼ ἐρεῖσαι
διὰ τὸ μὴ σ. τὴν ἀρτηρίαν

children.definition: σ. τὸν λογισμόν reason closely, Plu. Exil. 2.600e codd.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be firmly set, οἱ ὀδόντες συνηρείκασι Hp. Morb. Sacr. 7, cf. Sor. 2.27, Fract. 4 (prob.); ξυνερείσουσιν οἱ ὀδόντες Aret. SA 1.5; γένυς ξ. τῇ ἄνω is locked with . . , ib. 6; also of soldiers, σ. πρὸς ἀλλήλους Plb. 12.21.3, cf. Arr. Tact. 16.14.
meet in close conflict, τοῖς ἐναντίοις Plb. 5.84.2; dash together, of ships, D.S. 13.46, Plu. Them. 14; press on, τοὺς ὠθισμοὺς τοῖς προτεταγμένοις Arr. Tact. 12.3.
overthrow, destroy, τὴν τῶν ὀνομάτων οἰκοδομίαν Alcid. Soph. 25.
setting firmly together, ὀδόντων Hp. Epid. 7.18, cf. Sor. 2.17.
making a firm foundation, τόνος Stoic. 2.134, cf. Plu. Frig. 2.954e, Hierocl. p.23 A.

definition: συνερέω, Att. συνερῶ, pf. -είρηκα, fut. and pf. without pres. in use (v. συναγορεύω):—

children.definition: speak with or together, advocate, support in a speech, X. Cyr. 2.2.22, 8.1.6: c. dat., Lys. 12.86, D. 16.1, 22.40, Hyp. Lyc. 19; σ. νόμῳ D. 20.153. Cf. συνεῖπον.

definition: συνέρημα, ατος, τό, late spelling of συναίρημα, Stud.Pal. 22.168.1 (ii A.D.).

children.definition: contend together, ὑπέρ τινος LXX 2 Ma. 8.30: aor. Pass. in act. sense, ὁ Ἑρμῆς συνηρίσθη αὐτῇ (sc. τῇ Μοίρᾳ) PMag.Leid.W. 5.13.

fellow-worker, helpmate, esp. one who is hired to assist in domestic work, as spinning or sewing, Od. 6.32, PEnteux. 30.3 (iii B.C.), AP 9.89 ( Phil.), etc.; Μοῦσα . . μήτʼ ἔλθῃς σ. αὐτοῖς Ar. Pax 786 (lyr.); Κύπρις σ. ἀέθλων A.R. 3.942; σ. τέχναι assistant arts, Pl. R. 533d; ὅσαι ταύταις εἰσὶ σ. τέχναι Id. Lg. 889d: less freq. as masc. Adj., σ. ἄτρακτος AP 7.726 ( Leon.); λύχνος συνέριθος ὀδυνάων Musae. 11.

definition: συνερκτικός, ή, όν, ( συνέργω) of a speaker,

children.definition: driving his opponent into a corner, cogent, Ar. Eq. 1378 codd.: Sch., συνείρων τοὺς λόγους, points to συνερτικός (συνείρω II).
fellow-members of a guild of worshippers of Hermes, BCH 32.430 ( Delos).
forcing together, junction, ἐν τῇ σ. in close order of battle, D.C. 50.32; ἡ τῶν γάμων σ. wedlock, Pl. Ti. 18d: abs., Id. R. 460a.
confinement, ἡ εἰς σῶμα σ. Porph. Sent. 28, cf. Plu. Fr. 6.2; ζῴων Porph. Abst. 1.40.

definition: συνέρομαι, only in aor. inf. συνερέσθαι,

children.definition: ask with or together, Hsch., Phot., and part. -ερόμενος· συμβαλλόμενος, Hsch. (dub. l.).
creep or go together, Opp. H. 1.328: also συνέρπω, Arr. Epict. 2.24.18, AP 4.4.5 ( Agath.), Gloss.

definition: συνέρρωγα, pf. 2 of συρρήγνυμι (ΙΙ):— συνέρρωσε, in Heraclit. All. 52, is f.l. for συνέρρωγε.

children.definition: draw together, in aor. Pass., ὁκόταν . . συνειρυσθῇ ὑπὸ τοῦ ῥίγεος Hp. Morb. 1.26: pf. Pass. συνείρ<υ>ται· συνέσπασται, Hsch.
Act., τίς σε δαιμόνων κακῇ ἀθυμίῃ ξυνείρυσεν; Epigr. ap. D.L. 2.112.

definition: συνέρχομαι, fut. -ελεύσομαι Plu. Par.min. 2.306e, Phintys ap. Stob. 4.23.61; but the Att. fut. is σύνειμι ( εἶμι ibo), q. v., with aor. 2 συνῆλθον ( Dor. part. συνενθόντες Abh.Berl.Akad. 1925(5).21 ( Cyrene)) and pf. συνελήλυθα:—

children.definition: go together or in company, σύν τε δύʼ ἐρχομένω Il. 10.224.

children.label: II
children.definition: come together, assemble, meet, Hdt. 1.152, 3.159, 7.97, E. Ba. 714, Th. 1.3, etc.; συνέρχεσθαι τοὺς συνέδρους IG 42(1).68.66 ( Epid., iv B.C.); σ. ἐς τὠυτό Hdt. 1.202; εἰς ταὐτὸ εἰς μίαν νῆσον X. Ath. 2.2; εἰς τὸ κοινόν Pl. Lg. 680e; εἰς ἓν ἱερόν ib. 767c; ἐνθάδε Ar. Lys. 39; δεῦρο ἐς Κλεισθένους ib. 621 (lyr.); ἐκ τῶν ἀγρῶν Id. Pax 632 (troch.); ἀπὸ τῶν πόλεων Th. 5.55; ἐς λόγους σ. Hdt. 1.82, cf. Ar. Eq. 1300 (troch.): c. dat., without ἐς λόγους, BGU 1778.2 (i B.C.); σύνελθε πρὸς Θέωνα PSI 9.1079.3 (i B.C.); ἐπὶ τὸν ἀγῶνα, i.e. the Dramatic ἀγών, D. 21.55; and simply, ξ. τινί have dealings with, S. OT 572; σ. χοροῖς take part in . . , E. Hel. 1468 (lyr.).

meet in battle, σ. ἐς πεδίον Hdt. 1.80; εἰς μάχην Pl. Tht. 154e; κάπρῳ γὰρ ὡς συνῆλθεν ἀντίαν ἔριν PCair.Zen. 532.16 (iii B.C.); also of the battle, μάχη ὑπό τινων ξυνελθοῦσα engaged in, contested by them, Th. 5.74.

data.quote: κάπρῳ γὰρ ὡς συνῆλθεν ἀντίαν ἔριν

children.definition: come together, be united or banded together, ἐς τὠυτό Hdt. 4.120; φίλος φίλῳ ἐς ἓν σ. E. Ph. 462; δύο οἰκίαι σ. εἰς ταὐτόν Pl. Chrm. 157e; σ. τοῦ ζῆν ἕνεκεν Arist. Pol. 1278b24; σ. ἐπὶ κοινωνίᾳ βίω Phintys l.c.; form a league, of states, D. 18.19; come together, after quarrelling, ἀδελφοὶ . . οὔτε ῥᾳδίως σ. Plu. Frat. 2.481c.

children.label: b
children.definition: σ. τῷ ἀνδρί Hp. Mul. 2.143; σ. γυναιξί X. Mem. 2.2.4, cf. Pl. Smp. 192e, Str. 15.3.20; σ. εἰς ὁμιλίαν τινί, of a woman, D.S. 3.58; freq. of marriage-contracts, BGU 970.13 (ii A.D.), PGnom. 71, al. (ii A.D.), etc.: abs., of animals, couple, Arist. HA 541b34.
ταύτην τὴν στρατείαν ξ. joined in this expedition, Th. 1.3 ( ξυνεξ- is prob. cj.); τὸ σὸν λέχος ξυνῆλθον shared thy bed, S. Aj. 491.

children.label: III
children.definition: to be joined in one, συνερχόμενʼ εἰς ἕν Emp. 17.7; χάρις κείνου τέ σοι κἀμοῦ ξ. S. Tr. 619; τἀπʼ ἐμοῦ τε κἀπὸ σοῦ ἐς ἓν ξ. E. Tr. 1155; σ. εἰς ἕν Arist. Cael. 288a16; of one river joining another, Ar. Fr. 150 (dub.l.); of heavenly bodies, to be in conjunction, Arist. Mete. 343b31, 344a1; of a chasm, close, Plu. Par.min. 2.306e; so of a fistula, Meges ap. Orib. 44.24.10.

data.ref: Plu. Par.min. 2.306e; so of a fistula,

children.definition: concur, happen together, Hdt. 6.77; τῆς τύχης οὕτω σ. Plu. Cam. 13.
Stud.Pal. 22.182.1 (ii/iii A.D.).
ask a series of questions (about), Luc. Bis Acc. 22, Eun. VS p.466 B.

children.label: II
children.definition: λόγον σ. propound an argument by means of a series of questions, in Pass., S.E. P. 2.131, cf. Luc. Hist.Conscr. 17.
method of argument by a series of questions, S.E. P. 2.253 (sg. and pl.).
one must employ the method of successive questions, ib. S.E. P. 2.251.
eat together, Charon 10, Arist. EE 1245a13; συμπιεῖν καὶ συμφαγεῖν SIG 1179.19 (Cnidus, Tab.Defix.): c. dat., Pl. Lg. 881d, Ev.Luc. 15.2; μετά τινων LXX Ge. 43.32, Ep.Gal. 2.12.

definition: σύνεσις, Att. ξύνεσις, εως, ἡ, ( συνίημι)

children.definition: uniting, union, πέτρη τε ξύνεσίς τε δύω ποταμῶν Od. 10.515 (with ξυν- metri gr.).

data.quote: πέτρη τε ξύνεσίς τε δύω ποταμῶν

children.definition: χωρὶς ἕκαστος εἰς τὸ φρονεῖν ἀσθενής, συμβάλλων δὲ εἰς ἓν πᾶς ἐν τῇ συνόδῳ καὶ τῇ ὡς ἀληθῶς συνέσει τὸ φρονεῖν ἐγέννησε καὶ εὗρε Plot. 6.5.10.

data.quote: χωρὶς ἕκαστος εἰς τὸ φρονεῖν ἀσθενής, συμβάλλων δὲ εἰς ἓν πᾶς ἐν τῇ συνόδῳ καὶ τῇ ὡς ἀληθῶς συνέσει τὸ φρονεῖν ἐγέννησε καὶ εὗρε

children.label: II
children.definition: faculty of quick comprehension, mother-wit, sagacity, Democr. 77, Th. 2.62, 3.82, etc.; οἰκείᾳ ξυνέσει Id. 1.138, cf. Pl. Cra. 412a, Phlb. 19d, Arist. EN 1143a17, D. 18.127, Ev.Luc. 2.47, Gal. 6.457, etc.; hence of animals, ὃ [ζῷον] συνέσει . . ὑπερέχει τῶν ἄλλων Pl. Mx. 237d:—Phrases, ὅστις γε σύνεσιν ἔχει Hdt. 2.5, 7.49; ἀρκεῖν ξυνέσει E. Tr. 674; ξ. καὶ σοφία Id. HF 655 (lyr.); φρόνησίς τε καὶ ξ. Pl. Cra. 411a; σ. λαβεῖν, of children, Arist. EN 1161b26; μοῖραν ἔχειν συνέσεως ( αἰσθήσεως) Democr. ap. Thphr. Sens. 71; also with qualifying words added, σ. φρενῶν Pi. N. 7.60; γνώμης ξ. Th. 1.75; σ. πολιτική Arist. Pol. 1291a28; ἡ περὶ τὴν διάνοιαν σ. Id. HA 588a23; ἡ ὑμετέρα σ. as form of address, Sammelb. 7433.6 (v A.D.).

data.ref: Thphr. Sens. 71; also with qualifying words added,

children.definition: intelligence in a thing, sagacity in respect to it, Pl. Cra. 412c, D.S. 1.1; περὶ τῶν παρόντων Th. 2.97.

children.label: III
children.definition: conscience = συνείδησις, ἡ σ. (sc. μʼ ἀπόλλυσι) · ὅτι σύνοιδα δείνʼ εἰργασμένος E. Or. 396, cf. Men. 632, Plb. 18.43.13.

children.label: IV
children.definition: a branch of art or science, οἱ περὶ τὴν σ. ταύτην, i.e. music, Arist. Pol. 1342b8.

children.label: b
children.definition: knowledge, opp. ἄγνοια, Id. de An. 410b3.

children.label: V
children.definition: decision, decree, IG 5(1).1390.112 ( Andania, i B.C.). (Plato ( Cra. 412a) derives σύνεσις II from συνιέναι ( σύνειμι) come together, neglecting the unwritten aspiration ( συνἱέναι); but the form and signfs. point to συνίημι II, perceive, apprehend, cf. Arist. EN 1143a17.)
by joint preparation, v.l. in X. Oec. 11.19.
in a concentrated form, Procl. in Prm. p.533 S., Id. in Ti. 1.149 D.; opp. ἀνειλιγμένως, Herm. in Phdr. p.137 A.; σ. καὶ ἡνωμένως ib. p.114 A.
with earnest zeal, Eun. VS p.468 B.

definition: συνεσσάδδω, aor. inf. συνεσσάξαι, Cretan for *συν-εκ-σάττω,

children.definition: help to remove property, Leg.Gort. 3.13,16.
contractedly:

children.label: I
children.definition: with a short vowel, Ath. 3.106b, 9.393c.

children.label: II
children.definition: simply, frugally, σ. ζῆν Plu. Apophth. Lac. 2.216e, etc.; humbly, Poll. 3.137.
one must associate with, Πρωταγόρᾳ Pl. Prt. 313b.
in a constrained way, σ. ἔχειν Arist. Pol. 1340b1.
BSA 23.73 ( Macedonia, ii A.D., Pass.).
banqueting together, D.H. 4.49, Gloss.
boon-companion, Gloss.: metaph., Vett.Val. 345.10.
help to entertain, AP 4.3.24 ( Agath.):— Pass., live or feast along with or together, Lys. Fr. 53.2, Is. 3.70, D. 19.190, etc.; [ θεοῖς] Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.121f; μετά τινων IG 2(2).1214.14.

sharing oneʼs hearth or house, S. OT 249, E. Alc. 1151; σύσσιτος καὶ σ. Pl. Ep. 350c; ξυνέστιοι πόλεος his fellow-citizens, A. Th. 773 (lyr.); σ. δαιτός, of a bottle, AP 6.248 ( Marc. Arg.): c. dat. pers., σ. σοι καὶ ὁμοτράπεζος Pl. Euthphr. 4b, cf. Lg. 868e; ἀθανάτοισι σ. A.R. 1.1319; ἀμβροσίῃσι σ. AP 7.41; ὄρνις σ. ἀνθρώποισι Opp. C. 3.118: c. dat. pers. et gen. rei, χρὴ συνεστίους ἐμοὶ γοίνης γενέσθαι associates with me in the feast, E. El. 784.
guardian of the hearth, A. Ag. 703 (lyr.); σ. θεοί sharing the same hearth, i.e. temple, PGiss. 99.26 (ii A.D.).
as if twisted up, σ. εἰπεῖν speak tersely, Arist. Rh. 1401a5 (v.l.).
living together, ἐν τῇ συνεστοῖ Hdt. 6.128; cf. ἀπεστώ, εὐεστώ.

definition: συνεταιρέω, f.l. for ἑταιρέω in Aeschin. Ep. 7.3.

children.definition: make another oneʼs companion, Aq. Ps. 107(108).10 ( Pass.).
companion, partner, comrade, Sapph. 44.5 L.-P., Hdt. 7.193, LXX Jd. 15.2, Da. 2.17, Supp.Epigr. 1.572.7 ( Egypt): fem. συνεταιρ-ίς, ίδος, Erinn. 5.7, LXX Jd. 11.37, Ph. 1.194.
cause to understand, LXX Ps. 118(119).27, 34, Ne. 8.7.
E. Hec. 133.

intelligent, sagacious, wise, Democr. 98, Pi. P. 5.107, Hdt. 1.185 ( Comp.), etc.; φωνάεντα συνετοῖσιν Pi. O. 2.85; of Zeus and Apollo, ξυνετοὶ καὶ τὰ βροτῶν εἰδότες S. OT 498 (lyr.); ξ. φρένες Ar. Ra. 876 (lyr.); of animals, Arist. HA 589a1 ( Comp.); σ. ἡλικίη the age of wisdom, AP 5.111 ( Phld.), etc.; ἡ συνετή alone, ib. 11.25 ( Apollonid.); also τὸ σ., = σύνεσις, E. Or. 1180, Th. 2.15; τὸ πρὸς ἅπαν ξ. Id. 3.82: c. gen. rei, intelligent in a thing, ξ. πολέμου E. Or. 1406 (anap.): c. acc., τά τʼ οἰκτρὰ σ. εἰμι καὶ τὰ μή Id. IA 1255; τὰ ἀχρεῖα Th. 1.84; τὰ πολιτικά D.H. 4.45.

data.quote: τά τʼ οἰκτρὰ σ. εἰμι καὶ τὰ μή

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., intelligible, εὔμαρες σύνετον πόησαι πάντι τοῦτʼ Sapph. Supp. 5.5; οὐ ξ. θνητοῖς πείρατα Thgn. 1078; φρονέοντι συνετὰ γαρύω B. 3.85; συνετὰ αὐδᾶν, λέγειν, Hdt. 2.57, E. Ph. 498, etc.; esp. in oxymora, ἀναβοήσεται οὐ συνετὰ συνετῶς Id. IA 466; δυσξυνέτου ξυνετὸν μέλος Id. Ph. 1506 (lyr.): act. and pass. senses conjoined, εὐξύνετον ξυνετοῖς βοάν Id. IT 1092 (lyr.); φωνὴ σ. significant, Arist. Po. 1456b23.

data.ref: E. Ph. 498, etc.; esp. in oxymora,

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -τῶς intelligently, E. IA 466, Ar. V. 633 (lyr.).
intelligibly, διαλέγεσθαι Arist. Pr. 902a17; φθεγξαμένου . . οὐδὲν σ. Plu. Sull. 27; συνετὰ ὁμιλεῖν to discourse intelligibly, Babr. Prooem. 11.
join in deriving a word, Tz.ad Hes. Op. 54.
please likewise, συνεύαδε A.R. 3.30, cf. Ps.-Phoc. 191.
give oneʼs consent, IG 7.3325 ( Chaeronea), Test.Epict. 1.4, 4.4, Supp.Epigr. 2.299 ( Delph., i B.C., written συναυαρ-):— Med., D.S. 40.8.
fellow-bacchanal, Orph. Εὐχή 34.
share in happiness, X. HG 5.1.16; τινι with one, Luc. Herm. 10.

join in approving, give oneʼs consent, Demad. 17, Plb. 7.1.3, SIG 712.46 ( Crete, ii B.C., Dor. -ιόντων), PGrenf. 2.26.25 (ii B.C.), D.S. 4.24, Act.Ap. 22.20, etc.; συνευδοκέοντος τοῦ δεῖνα, in forms of sale, GDI 1532a4, 1555a5 (Delph.), etc.
consent or agree to a thing, LXX 1 Ma. 1.57, POxy. 1644.27 (i B.C.), BGU 1731.12 (i B.C.), Ev.Luc. 11.48, etc.
agree or sympathize with . . , Ep.Rom. 1.32.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., aor. συνευδοκήθην in signf. 1.3, D.S. 18.49; so ὅκκα [τὰ μέρεα] . . συνευδοκῆται ἀλλάλοις Theag. ap. Stob. 3.1.117.
formal consent, POxy. 1276.19, 1638.31 (both iii A.D.).
sleep or lie with, c. dat., Hdt. 3.69; τῷ παλαμναίῳ S. El. 587, cf. E. El. 1145; τοῦ ξυνεύδοντος χρόνου the time coincident with sleep, A. Ag. 894.
join in doing good to, prob. cj. in J. AJ 18.8.9 ( Pass.).
enjoy the day or be happy together, Plu. Cor. 4.
acquiesce in, approve, τοῖς δρωμένοις Them. Or. 8.102d.
straighten as well, Them. Or. 27.338b, Paul.Aeg. 6.120 (v.l. εὐθυνέτω).
share delight in, τερατείαις Sch. Luc. Icar. p.98R.
assist in regulating, γυμνικοὺς ἀγῶνας Arch.Pap. 3.134 ( Thera, iii/ii B.C.): c. dat. pers., IG 5(2).265.7 ( Mantinea, i B.C.).
cause to lie with, τινά τινι Apollod. 2.4.10, etc.:— Pass., lie with, Pi. P. 4.254, S. OT 982, Hp. Nat.Mul. 17.
to be a consort, sleep with, τινι Tz. H. 9.536 ( συνευνητεῖ codd.).

bed-fellow, consort, E. Med. 240, Hipp. 416 (pl.), etc.; Dor. ξυνευνέτας Supp.Epigr. 7.69 (near Antioch on Orontes, i A.D.): fem. συνευν-έτις, ιδος, ἡ, wife or concubine, E. Andr. 908, APl. 16.182.8 ( Leon.).
Hsch., Phot., Suid.
wife, Supp.Epigr. 6.796.24 ( Cappadocia, iii A.D.).
to be well disposed towards, τινι PStrassb. 40.39 (vi A.D.).
colleagues in the εὐνομία (q.v. in Addendis), GDI 5119a (p.422, Crete).

bed-fellow, consort, mostly of the wife, Pi. O. 1.88, A. Ag. 1116 (lyr.), 1442, S. Aj. 1301, E. Med. 1001 (lyr.), BGU 1080.23 (iii A.D.), etc.; but of the husband, A. Pr. 866, Ar. Ec. 953 (lyr.), AP 7.599 ( Jul.), 600 ( Id.): fem. συνεύνα ib. 5.194 (dub. l., Mel.), IG 12(3).238 ( Astypalaea).
scientific, ἀνείλησις, of gymnastic exercises, Aret. CD 1.2.
receive favours or derive profit together, D. 8.64,65, but better written σὺν εὖ πεπονθότων, cf. ἀντευπάσχω.
contribute, c.acc., τριάκοντα μνᾶς ἐδεῖτό μου . . συνευπορῆσαι D. 33.6: abs., σ. ἐκ τῶν ἰδίων πρὸς τὴν κοινὴν σωτηρίαν Lycurg. 139.

data.quote: σ. ἐκ τῶν ἰδίων πρὸς τὴν κοινὴν σωτηρίαν

children.definition: contribute towards, σ. τινὶ προικός Is. 11.37; σ. ἐκείνῳ χρημάτων, αὐτῷ ἀναλωμάτων, D. 8.19, 59.72.
assist, help, τινι Din. 1.58; help in contriving, σ. ὅπως ἂν . . Plu. Lyc. 15.
find also, Men. Epit. 84; help to find, Luc. JTr. 5:— Pass., to be found with, c. dat., Sch.D.T. p.204 H.; dub. sens. in PSI 1.98.1 (vi A.D.), PLond. 5.1708.88 (vi A.D.).
widen or extend together, Ph. 1.209 ( Pass.).
join in worship, Benndorf-Niemann Reisen in Lykien p.156 No. 134 (Lagina, Caria), BCH 11.376 ( Panamara), Supp.Epigr. 4.302,390 (ibid.).
observe decency with, τῇ κρίσει Plu. Virt.mor. 2.442e.
to be vigorous at the same time, Sor. 1.88.
to be well-nourished also, Sor. 1.97.
to be fortunate together, βίον during life, E. Hipp. 1117 (lyr.); τισι Str. 10.4.10, 13.4.1.
use words of good omen, shout applause or blessings, Ph. 2.58, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.272a, v.l. in D.S. 5.49.
counsel well with, A.R. 3.918; better written divisim, σὺν εὖ φρ., with some codd.
rejoice together, D.H. Rh. 2.5, Ph. 1.405; μετὰ γυναικός LXX Pr. 5.18; τινι with one, D. 18.217, Hdn. 2.8.9.
united prayer, in pl., Charito 6.2, 8.6.

join in prayer, E. IT 1221 (troch.); ταὐτὰ δὴ ξ. Id. Hel. 646; παῖς πατρὶ σ. Pl. Lg. 687e, cf. JRS 17.51 ( Phrygia, iv A.D.), etc.: c. acc. rei et inf., ξ. τέλεα πόλει . . γενέσθαι Ar. Th. 352 (lyr.); σ. σοι ταῦτα γενέσθαι Pl. Phdr. 257b, cf. X. Oec. 7.8; μετά τινος Pl. Lg. 909e; also τοῖς φίλοις ταῦτα for oneʼs friends too, ib. 687d, cf. Phdr. 279c, D.C. 52.4.
feast together, Arist. EE 1245b5, Posidon. 15J., Ph. 2.355; ὑμῖν 2 Ep.Pet. 2.13, cf. J. AJ 1.3.5, BGU 596.10 (i A.D.), Luc. VH 2.15, etc.; [ ἀνδριάντι] PMag.Par. 1.3150.
fellow-banqueter, Sch.D Il. 17.577, Hsch. s.v. εἰλαπιναστής.
choose in addition by consent, GDI 1832.13 (Delph.).

lay hold of jointly, ξίφους τινί Plu. Brut. 52; so without gen., συνεφάπτεσθαι . . ταῖς χερσὶ (with the hands) καὶ αὐτόν Gal. 10.430: metaph., put hand to along with another, take part, Pi. O. 10(11).97; οὐκ ἔφη . . γιγνώσκειν τῶν συμμάχων τοὺς ὥσπερ συνεφαπτομένους τοῖς σπένδουσι τῶν ἱερῶν said he did not acknowledge those allies who as it were lay hands along with the offerers of libations upon the victims, i.e. who wish to share the profits, without the expenses and dangers of the war, Aeschin. 2.84; σ. τῆς στρατείας Plu. Tim. 8, Luc. Am. 6; τῆς διακονίας Plu. Phil. 2; τοῦ φόνου Id. Brut. 17; τῆς δημιουργίας τῷ θεῷ Jul. Or. 4.150b; to be connected with, [ τοῦτο] σ. ἑτέρου γένους νοσήματος Gal. 10.233; of a muscle, -όμενος καὶ τοῦ πήχεως Id. 18(2).986.
join one in attacking, Hdt. 7.158.
fit along with or together, τινί τι Sch. Ar. Av. 424, cf. Procl. Par.Ptol. 284.
wait in reserve, of troops, τισι Plb. 1.27.9, cf. 7.16.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: watch closely, τῷ τῶν Ἀρδιαίων ἔθνει Id. 2.12.2; σ. τοῖς καιροῖς Id. 31.8.6.

draw after or along with one, Pl. Phd. 80e, Ep. 335b, Arist. de An. 406b21:— Pass., to be drawn on together, Id. Ph. 244a11; τῇ τοῦ ὅλου περιφορᾴ Id. Mete. 341a2; to be drawn up also, Id. Pr. 949a16, Thphr. CP 4.13.5:— Med., much like Act., Hp. Mul. 1.68, Phld. Mus. p.62 K., Ph. 2.61, al., Plu. Vit.pud. 2.529c, Aret. SD 1.13, Eun. VS p.498

definition: συνεφέπομαι, aor. -εφεσπόμην, Ion. -επεσπόμην, poet. imper. συνεπίσπεο Lyr.Alex.Adesp. 20.2:— follow together, Hdt. 9.102, X. Cyr. 6.4.10, Pl. Lg. 701a, etc.; τινι with one, X. An. 4.8.18, etc.: metaph., σ. τῷ λόγῳ Pl. Sph. 254c. -->

children.definition: serve as ἔφηβοι together, Plu. Praec. 2.816b.
group of συνέφηβοι, Supp.Epigr. 4.301.15 ( Panamara, ii A.D., pl.).

fellow-ἔφηβος, Aeschin. 1.49, 2.167, IG 2(2).1043.70, 2127.5, OGI 188.7 ( Philae), Plu. Frat. 2.482a, Charito 8.6, Luc. Tim. 48; at Sparta, member of the same ἀγέλη, IG 5(1).38, al.; Συνέφηβοι, a name of comedies by Menander and others.

definition: συνεφίαζεν (leg. συνεφεί-): " εἷα" (leg. εἷα) ἐκάλει, Hsch.

children.definition: join in granting, συνεφίοντος κατὰ τὸ δάνειον καὶ συνομολογοῦντος Πυθοκρίτου IG 12(5).872.75 ( Tenos, iii B.C.).

data.quote: συνεφίοντος κατὰ τὸ δάνειον καὶ συνομολογοῦντος Πυθοκρίτου

definition: συνεφίστημι and συνεφ-ιστάνω ( Plb. 7.13.2): aor. 1 -επέστησα Demad. 57:—

children.definition: set as watchers or guards, τοὺς ἱππεῖς D.S. 17.84: metaph., set on the watch, make attentive, τοὺς ἀναγινώσκοντας Plb. 10.41.6; τινὰ ἐπὶ τὰς μάχας Id. 11.19.2; τοὺς φιλοπευστοῦντας περί τινων Id. 3.59.6.
τὸν νοῦν), attend to, observe along with, ἐπὶ τὰ λεγόμενα Id. 3.9.4; τοῖς ὑπομνήμασι Id. 9.2.7, cf. 4.40.10, etc.; dub. l. in Vett.Val. 241.15.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass. συνεφίστᾰμαι, with aor. 2 Act., stand over, superintend along with or together, Th. 2.75.
rise together, κατά τινων against them, Act.Ap. 16.22.
occur together, τινι with . . , Dsc. Ther.Praef., v.l. for συνυφ- in Porph. Sent. 27.
help in equipping or assisting, Ptol. Tetr. 47.
inspect or superintend together, ib. Ptol. Tetr. 146, Them. Or. 9.122c.
to be joint-ephor, IG 5(1).1317 ( Thalamae, iv/iii B.C.).
urge on together, Hsch.
joint-ephor, CIG 4157 ( Sinope).

continuity, τῆς κινήσεως Arist. Metaph. 1050b26; [ τῶν νεύρων] Id. HA 515b6; [ ἡ ῥάχις] μία μὲν διὰ τὴν σ., πολυμερὴς δὲ τῇ διαιρέσει τῶν σπονδύλων Id. PA 654b15, cf. HA 559a7; σ. ἔχειν πρός τι Id. PA 652b3; ὁ ὅλος ὄγκος ὥσπερ κατὰ συνέχειαν τρέφεται καὶ ἐπιδίδωσι Thphr. CP 1.12.4; σ. γίνεται there is a continuous succession (of flowering), Id. HP 6.8.4, cf. 7.10.3; σ. τῶν ἀκροβολισμῶν, τῆς μάχης, Plb. 5.100.2, Hdn. 8.5.2.

data.quote: ἡ ῥάχις] μία μὲν διὰ τὴν σ., πολυμερὴς δὲ τῇ διαιρέσει τῶν σπονδύλων
ὁ ὅλος ὄγκος ὥσπερ κατὰ συνέχειαν τρέφεται καὶ ἐπιδίδωσι

children.label: b
children.definition: coherence, πρὸς τὰ οἰκεῖα μέρη Stoic. 2.145; νόσος . . τῆς σ. [τοῦ σώματος] τῶν μερῶν διαίρεσις Gal. 7.2; ὀδύνη γίνεται . . τῆς σ. λυομένης Id. 15.515.

data.quote: νόσος . . τῆς σ. [τοῦ σώματος] τῶν μερῶν διαίρεσις

children.label: c
children.definition: κατὰ συνέχειαν ἀριθμεῖσθαι to be reckoned by conjunction (e.g. 1, 2, 3, 4; 4, 5, 6, 7), Steph. in Hp. 1.198 D.

sequence of words, Pl. Sph. 261e, 262c; connexion in a sentence, τῶν ὀνομάτων D.H. Vett.Cens. 5.2, cf. Comp. 23; γραμμάτων Demetr. Eloc. 68; also of argument, αἱ κατὰ συνέχειαν [προτάσεις], = συνημμένα ἀξιώματα (cf. συνάπτω A. III.3), Stoic. 2.71, cf. 85; σ. ἀποδείξεων Luc. Dem.Enc. 32; ἡ ἐν τῷ λογίζεσθαι σ. Plu. An seni 2.792d; πυκνότης καὶ συνέχεια Hermog. Id. 2.10.
link, Arist. Ph. 222a10.
sequence, chain of cause and effect, ἐπισύνδεσις καὶ σ. τῶν αἰτίων Alex.Aphr. Fat. 195.3; τῶν ἐφεξῆς σ. καὶ συμπλοκή Plot. 3.1.4.

continuity of substance, viscosity, (sc. ἐλαίου) Thphr. Od. 18; of dripping honey, μὴ . . ὑγρόν, ὡς ἀποσπᾶσθαι τῆς σ. Gal. 6.270; ἡ πρὸς τὸν ὀμφαλὸν τοῦ ἐμβρύου σ. Sor. 1.71; of broken bones, Id. Fract. 5, al.; σ. τῶν φυτῶν Hdn. 7.2.5.
compactness, close order, of military formation, Arr. Tact. 11.4, Ael. Tact. 11.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: continued attention, perseverance, D. 18.218; continuance of an action, τῇ σ. τῆς μελέτης Hierocl. in CA 27p.484M.; practice, Plot. 4.6.3; συνεχείας δηλωτική, = frequentativa, Gloss.
holding together:

children.label: I
children.definition: continuous, Parm. 8.6, 25, Arist. Metaph. 1069a5, Ph. 200b18, al.; of quantity, opp. διωρισμένος, Id. Cat. 4b20; σ. νῶτον Pl. R. 616e; συνεχὲς ποικίλον a continuity of variety, Id. Phd. 110d; σ. οἰκήματα Th. 3.21.

children.label: b
children.definition: continuous with or contiguous to, in a line with, Hdt. 4.22, E. Hipp. 226 (anap.), Arist. Mete. 339a22, Mu. 392a23, etc.: less freq. c. gen., ib. 393a29 (s. v.l.); τομαὶ σ. ἀπὸ μιᾶς μέχρι τῶν δέκα Pl. Lg. 738a: abs., σ. ἦσαν Κίλικες Plb. 30.25.4, cf. Str. 11.6.2.

data.ref: Mu. 392a23, etc.: less freq. c. gen., ib.

data.quote: τομαὶ σ. ἀπὸ μιᾶς μέχρι τῶν δέκα

children.definition: ξ. ῥῆσις Th. 5.85; πᾶς ὁ σ. λόγος Plb. 1.5.5; τούτῳ συνάπτοντες τὸ σ. Id. 3.3.2; τὸ σ. connexion of letters, Plu. Lys. 19: c. dat., λόγος σ. τῷ νυνδὴ γενόμενος Pl. Ep. 318e; σκέψις σ. τοῖς πρότερον Thphr. CP 6.3.3.
σ. ἀναλογία continued proportion (opp. διῃρημένη), i.e. three terms in geometrical progression, Arist. EN 1131a33, Archim. Aequil. 2.9; κατὰ τὸ σ. ἀνάλογον Id. Sph. Cyl. 2.5, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: successive, of integers as terms in a series, Theol.Ar. 54; of middle terms in argument, Arist. APo. 87b6.

continuous, conjoined, Id. HA 509b13, etc.; folld. by a Prep., σ. πρός τι ib. 495b20; of substance, clinging, dense, τὸ γλίσχρασμα [τῆς πτισάνης] λεῖον καὶ σ. … ἐστι Hp. Acut. 10, cf. Gal. 6.822; ἀήρ, ἔλαιον, Plu. Pyth. 2.396a, QConv. 696b; τὸ πυκνὸν καὶ σ. ib. 701f; [ γάλα] λεῖον καὶ ὁμαλὸν καὶ σ. ἑαυτῷ Sor. 1.91.

data.ref: Id. HA 509b13, etc.; folld. by a Prep.,

data.quote: τὸ γλίσχρασμα [τῆς πτισάνης] λεῖον καὶ σ. … ἐστι
γάλα] λεῖον καὶ ὁμαλὸν καὶ σ. ἑαυτῷ

children.label: II
children.definition: continuous, unintermitting, σ. πυρετός, opp. διαλείπων, Hp. Aph. 3.21; sts. distd. from σύνοχος πυρετός, Anon. ap. Gal. 17(1).220; σ. καύματα καὶ πυρετούς Pl. Ti. 86a; [ θερμότης] Thphr. Ign. 33; κίνησις Id. Lass. 15; πόνος -έστερος Th. 7.81; πόλεμος διὰ βίου σ. Pl. Lg. 625e; συνουσία, βασιλεία, X. Smp. 8.18 ( Comp.), Ages. 1.4; πότοι Men. 914, cf. Sophil. 3; σ. κακοπαθίαι OGI 244.12 ( Daphne, ii B.C.); σ. γίνεσθαι, πνεῖν, of winds, Arist. Mete. 362a11, 26, Thphr. Vent. 1; τὸ ἀκρίτως ξ. τῆς ἁμίλλης Th. 7.71; τὸ σ. ἔργου (prob. for ἔργον) Anaxandr. 63; τοῦ δήμου τὸ σ. continuous intercourse with . . , Plu. Per. 7; κατὰ τὸ σ. continuously, Plb. 2.2.7; consecutively, in what follows, Gal. 15.116; ἐκ τούτου κατὰ τὸ σ. immediately after that, ib. 902.
frequent, τῶν ὀρνίθων ἥκιστα σ. καὶ συνήθης [ὁ γύψ] Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.286a; λουτροῖς συνεχέσι χρῆσθαι Sor. 1.65; χάσμη σ. ib. 24; -εστέρα ἔστω ἡ ἐκμύζησις ib. 97.

children.label: III
children.definition: constant, persevering, X. Oec. 21.9; ἐν ταῖς . . πρὸς τὰ πάθη διαμάχαις Plu. Adul. 2.74c; cf. Poll. 4.20, 6.147.

data.quote: ἐν ταῖς . . πρὸς τὰ πάθη διαμάχαις

children.label: B
children.definition: Adv. σῠνεχῶς, Ep. and Ion. -έως (v. sub fin.):

children.label: I
children.definition: continually, continuously, unremittingly, Hes. Th. 636, Hdt. 7.16.γʹ, E. IA 1008, IG 1(2).57.54, etc.; ξ. πολεμεῖν Th. 2.1, cf. 1.11, 5.24, Antipho 6.44; συνεχέως αἰεί Hdt. 1.67, cf. Pl. Lg. 706a; ἀεὶ σ. ib. 807e; οἱ σ. ἐτῶν οὐκ ὀλίγων ἐφεξῆς γενόμενοι (v.l. γιν-) λιμοί Gal. 6.749: Comp. -έστερον A.D. Pron. 65.17: Sup. -έστατα X. Mem. 4.2.6.

children.label: b
children.definition: without leaving an interval, immediately, ἐπίθυε . . , καὶ λέγε τὸν λόγον συνεχῶς τὸν τῆς ἐπικλήσεως PMag.Par. 1.1865, cf. BGU 451.15 (i/ii A.D.), PFlor. 332.18 (ii A.D.); δίδοται πρὸς τὰ θανάσιμα σ. πινόμενον καὶ ἐξεμούμενον Dsc. 1.30; βδέλλας καύσας καὶ λεάνας χρῶ σ. προεκτίλας (sc. superfluous eyelashes) Aët. 7.69.

data.quote: ἐπίθυε . . , καὶ λέγε τὸν λόγον συνεχῶς τὸν τῆς ἐπικλήσεως
δίδοται πρὸς τὰ θανάσιμα σ. πινόμενον καὶ ἐξεμούμενον

children.label: c
children.definition: at frequent intervals, ἵνα μὴ σ. λούηται τὸ βρέφος Sor. 1.99; μελίκρατον σ. ἐνστάζομεν ib. 123; τὰ βρέφη -έστερον ἐξερᾷ [τὸ γάλα] . . ναυτιῶντα ib. 109; ποτίζων -έστερον ἐκ διαστημάτων Gp. 10.18.5; -έστερον, = saepius, Gloss.; -έστατα, = saepissime, ib.

data.quote: ἵνα μὴ σ. λούηται τὸ βρέφος

children.definition: in succession, consecutively, ὁρμαθοὺς μελῶν ἐφεξῆς τέτταρας ξ. Ar. Ra. 915; ἡμέρας ἑβδομήκοντα ξ. Th. 2.75; μῆνας ὀκτὼ σ. Ephipp. 5.15 (anap.); similarly, οὐ σ. ἐφεξῆς ἐν τάξει πεποιημένος [τὸν λόγον] Gal. 15.496.
σ. εἶναι πᾶσαν οἰκουμένην Arist. Mete. 362b29; σ. μέχρι . . Plb. 2.14.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: συνεχές as Adv. freq. in Ep., as Il. 12.26; strengthd., σ. αἰεί unceasing ever, Od. 9.74; also in Pi. I. 4(3).65(83), Ar. Eq. 21, and freq. in later Ep., Arat. 20, Call. Ap. 60, etc.; also in later Prose, Luc. Somn. 4, D.L. 2.32, al. [ σῡνεχές Hom. ll. cc. and σῡνεχέως Hes. l.c., B. 5.113, metri gr.; also Theoc. 20.12, A.R. 1.1271.]

data.ref: Ar. Eq. 21, and freq. in later
Call. Ap. 60, etc.; also in later Prose,

children.definition: hate together, join in hating, Phld. Hom. p.41 O., AP 6.20 ( Jul.).

definition: συνέχθω, poet. for συνεχθαίρω, S. Ant. 523.

children.definition: persist, ἔν τινι Metrod. Herc. 831.8: c. part., Phld. Mus. p.23 K.: abs., Id. Oec. p.70 J., Rh. 1.150 S.; make continuous, Dam. Pr. 112; ἀναπνοὴ -ίζουσα respiration which leaves no intervals, rapid, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus. 58.70.
Phld. Mus. p.23 K., Agathin. ap. Orib. 10.7.5.
Phld. Rh. 1.47 S.

definition: συνέχω, aor. συνέσχον:— Med., fut. συνέξομαι in pass. sense, D. Ep. 3.40: so συσχόμενος (v. infr.), Pl. Sph. 250d:— Pass., aor. συνεσχέθην Epicur. Ep. 2p.35U.: fut. inf. συσχεθήσεσθαι Phld. Ir. p.97 W.:—

children.definition: hold or keep together, confine, secure, ὅθι ζωστῆρος ὀχῆες χρύσειοι σύνεχον [θώρηκα] Il. 4.133, 20.415; ἵνα τε ξυνέχουσι τένοντες ἀγκῶνος where the sinews of the elbow hold [it] together, ib. 478 (but perh. meet, v. infr. II); Ὠκεανός . . συνεῖχε σάκος enclosed, compassed it, Hes. Sc. 315; Αἴτνα σ. [Τυφῶνα] Pi. P. 1.19; τὼ μηρὼ σ. hold them together, Ar. Nu. 966; τὰ σκέλη [τοῦ βρέφους] συνεχέτω Sor. 1.101; τοὺς τρεῖς ξυνέχων τῶν δακτύλων Ar. V. 95; συνέσχον τὰ ὦτα αὐτῶν closed or stopped their ears, Act.Ap. 7.57; μηδὲ συσχέτω ἐπʼ ἐμὲ φρέαρ τὸ στόμα αὐτοῦ let not the pit close its mouth upon me, LXX Ps. 68(69).15, cf. Is. 52.16; τὸ δέρμα σ. [τὰ ὀστᾶ] Pl. Phd. 98d; Ἄτλας ἅπαντα σ. ib. 99c; λάκκους συντετριμμένους, οἳ οὐ δυνήσονται ὕδωρ συνέχειν LXX Je. 2.13:— Pass., τὸ λεγόμενον ἐν φρέατι συσχόμενος" trapped in a well, Pl. Tht. 165b; ὁ καρπὸς . . ἂν μὴ πλυθῇ . . συνέχεται sticks together, Thphr. HP 3.15.4; τὸ στόμα οὐ συνεσχέθη ἔτι my mouth was no longer closed, LXX Ez. 33.22.

data.quote: λάκκους συντετριμμένους, οἳ οὐ δυνήσονται ὕδωρ συνέχειν

children.definition: keep together, keep from dispersing, στράτευμα, δύναμιν, X. An. 7.2.8, D. 8.76; σ. ἐν τῷ χάρακι Plb. 10.39.1; ὥπλισε . . καὶ συνεῖχε τοῦ τείχους ἐντός Plu. Cam. 23; περὶ Κύπρον σ. τὸ ναυτικόν Id. Cim. 18; continue, keep on, μὴ πλείους πέντε ἡμερῶν σύσχῃς τὸ ὕδωρ (the flooding) PCair.Zen. 155.5 (iii B.C.); keep, τοὺς πολίτας σ. ἐν τοῖς ὅπλοις Plu. Sol. 22, cf. Apophth.reg. 2.193e; προστάξαντος αὐτοῦ ἐν τοῖς ὅπλοις συνέχειν ἑαυτόν, ὁ δὲ ἀπεδύσατο Ael. VH 14.48; preserve, οἱ ἅλες ἐπὶ πλεῖστον [τὰ σώματα] συνέχοντες Ph. 2.255; maintain, σ. τοὺς στρατιώτας ἐκ τῶν ἱεροσυληθέντων λειψάνων D.S. 16.61:— Pass., to be continuous, Parm. 8.23; to be maintained, πᾶσα ἕξις . . ὑπὸ τῶν καταλλήλων ἔργων συνέχεται καὶ αὔξεται Arr. Epict. 2.18.1.

data.quote: ὥπλισε . . καὶ συνεῖχε τοῦ τείχους ἐντός
τοὺς πολίτας σ. ἐν τοῖς ὅπλοις
